Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: TGH56003
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant place to stay. It is right near Herald Square and Penn Station, so public transportation was a breeze. The room was comfortable and clean, and the hotel staff were uniformly pleasant and attentive. There is an ample and good free breakfast in the morning, consisting of bagels, donuts, muffins, coffee, and juice. It is all one would need for a stay in New York, and the price is amazingly reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: gortnagluggin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 40th b-day, for 4 days. 3 guys in one room , 3 girls in another, 2 double beds, in each. Worked out well, great location regarding bars, shops, restaurants, subway etc. St Patricks weekend. Skipped breakfast every morning, went over to speedys, fresh juice is amazing. Legends bar next street to catch the premier league, great bar! 2nd time staying here, would deffo recommend. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: MikeGB2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times now and is always proves to be one of the most inexpensive rooms in Manhattan. Even during the summer they seem to have great rates that beat seemingly any of the competition in this area. Although it doesn't look much from the outside and even the lobby, the rooms are always clean, and also a fair size, which is unusual for this area. The staff are mainly Korean, as this is the heart of Korea Town, and they are always friendly and very helpful. A light breakfast is included and is served in the attached coffee shop, which is really not much more than bagels, (which are delicious!), muffins, toast, buns, fruit, oramge juice and coffee, but honestly what more do you need for a day's shopping in NY anyway! If you are looking for a great litle hotel in amongst some not so great ones, at affordable prices this is definitely one to try!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hospitality and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: sonhomeu
Reviews.Content: This may be the best deal in all of NYC! Located right between Macy's and the Empire State Building in midtown, the Hotel Stanford is a true gem. My parents are still raving to everyone in Texas about their awesome stay at the perfectly located Hotel Stanford last fall. Excellent service, rooms much bigger than the NYC standard, breakfast being included, cleanliness standards above and beyond the call of duty, in addition to the ideal location, all combine to make the Hotel Stanford my favorite hotel in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: NohaG_04
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is its biggest advantage. Located in the Garment District near Herald Square is where you wanna go for shopping and/or be in the center of everything. Times Square is 10 blocks away (a ten-minute walk) and there is a subway station less than 20 meters away (34th street - Herald Square) which is a main subway station with several trains running. The hotel itself is pretty basic but clean, comfortable with a friendly staff who are willing to help in any means possible. I was in the city for shopping and I had lots of stuff, they helped us with a vaccum cleaner to use for our space bags for several days. The rooms are a bit larger than those i stayed in other hotels in NYC. The bathroom toiletries are from Bed Bath & Beyond (i loved that!)The breakfast is pretty basic but so is that of all the hotels. Overall, i would recommend for anyone who wants to stay in a decent clean hotel in a great location but on a smaller budget than that of 5* hotels!

Reviews.Title: “A budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bologna60
Reviews.Content: The most valuable point is the perfect position, near Macy and the the Empire State Building, at walking distance from Times Square, beside two metro stops with different directions. We occupied a quadruple room that resulted very spatious and clean. The breakfast room is obtained in the cake-shop of the hotel, so the food resulted only based on bakery products and it may be not suitable for babies, however breakfast included in the price is a value in cental Manhattan. We confirm that the only lift may be not sufficient in some rush hours for an 11-floors bluiding.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in a central location!”
Reviews.Author: KTReview
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Stanford in December 2011 with 3 friends. We booked into the Delux Suite which sleeps 4 people comfortably. Overall, I was extremely impressed with the hotel and it's facilities and found it to be very good value for money. The hotel was easy to find and the staff were extremely polite and efficient on arrival. We were taken straight to our room on the 3rd floor. The room / suite was extremely spacious, with a seperate lounge area with sofas, a sleeping area with 2 extremely comfortable double beds and built in wardrobe and a spacious bathroom. The room was extremely clean and tidy, with a large flat screen television. My only criticism would be that the fridge did not seem to work, so it wasn't possible to keep anything cold or make ice cubes. Also, there wasn't a great deal of storage space for clothes etc and only a few coat hangers in the wardrobe, but this wasn't the end of the world. The bathroom was also very clean, with a bath and shower (combined), towels and toiletteries changed on a daily basis. Although I did not see the maid, the maid service was very good and we left a generous tip. Being on the 3rd floor, meant that we did not have to use the lift, which was quite small but perfectly adequate. The reception area was pleasant and well maintained and door staff were very helpful. The bar on the second floor was also very nice and decorated to a modern standard. It would've been nice if hotel guests had been able to eat breakfast in the bar area, but this wasn't possible. It was a nice place to go and chill out, with free WiFi, and tea and coffee during the afternoon. I didn't have a drink there in the evening, but I believe the drinks were a little bit expensive. The breakfast area was a little on the small side, but we only had to queue on our first day and the wait wasn't too long. The breakfast is a bit limited, but it was included in the price and meant that we weren't having to look for somewhere to eat every morning and to be honest it was enough to keep us going until lunch time. They serve a selection of cakes, e.g. donuts and muffins, bagels and a limited selection of fruit (usually apples). Drinks included tea, coffee, fruit juice or ice water. It is all self service but you can help yourself to as much or as little as you like. You can't take food up to your rooms (there is an extra charge for this) so you have to sit at one of the tables to eat there. The location itself is excellent as it is pretty much central to all the main attractions, with the Empire State Building literally a 2 minute walk around the corner. It's also very near to some of the main shops including Macy's 34th Street store and many of the main high street stores. There is a subway station on the corner which takes you pretty much anywhere you need to go, uptown or downtown and the 7 day subway passes are extremely reasonsable if you plan to use the subway a lot. As for places to eat, there are plenty of places near by. I would definitely recommend Hartlands Brewery underneath the Empire State Building for a traditional American Grill experience. And if you're on a real tight budget, there are a lot of places where you can buy a slice of pizza on the go, or McDonalds, KFC and Subway all within walking distance. Being in the Koreon District there are also a number of Eastern European restaurants nearby. Dwayne Read (Convenience Store) is just a round the corner and is extremely useful for any bits you might need on your stay, from cosmetics to nibbles! All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel and New York in general. Staying in a suite was probably better than staying in a standard room, which might be on the small side, but you should definitely give this hotel a go if you're looking for somewhere in a central location, reasonably priced and well maintained! It's not the Plaza, but I would certainly recommend it and would definitely go there again if I revisit New York!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise! All Korean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: techgrrl
Reviews.Content: We were surprised to find the hotel and everything around it to be in Korean. The room was comfortable and clean. However, there is only 1 tiny elevator so you sometimes wait a long time. The breakfast offered is just very sweet pastries. There is a bar with half price drinks before 8pm. However, it was deserted most times. Friendly staff and great location. Don't expect to be able to get a taxi though. The street is very, very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad price.”
Reviews.Author: Albertvo
Reviews.Content: The best of the hotel is the location. Just in the middle of Korea town and 50 meters far from 5th avenue. Obviously, the price includes the location, but all the rest clearly does not worth the money. Old-fashioned rooms for an old-fashion hotel. Old-fashion style is ok when it's charming, it isn't when its non-functional. There was only 1 elevator for 10 floors. Obviously is always very crowded and more than once we got down on foot. We were lucky and we didn't to wait very long for having breakfast. The breakfast room is small and huge queues are formed every morning. A hotel that claims to be "luxus" or at least "business class" cannot afford to do that. Furniture of the rooms reminded me "the love boat" style. Furthermore, at 5 o'clock in the morning a group of crazy koreans began to sing (shout) with an unknown but horrible song. We couldn't sleep any more. After leaving, we were charged 2 times for the room. We got our money back after a few days, but this mistake completed our horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Heather A
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a superb location, just minutes from a subway station and Macy's! Its a great hotel, if your just looking for somewhere to sleep. The rooms are a bit dated but clean. There is only one lift for 12 floors of rooms, so if its busy, you can wait a while. The continental breakfast was satisfactory, just make sure you get up early in order to get a seat, as they don't allow you to "take out". The heating was far too hot and doesn't seem to adjust with the thermostat in the room. On our last day, the hotel boiler broke so there was no hot water or heating when we got up that morning but this was fixed within 2 hours (from the comments of the staff though, I do wonder if this is a regular occurence). If your not expecting much from your hotel and its more the location that matters, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's experience”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: Very clean, friendly staff. This is an older hotel ideally situated close to Time Square and theatres surrounded by eateries of all classes. Breakfast is offered as part of the room rental. Our suggestion on the breakfast is to add some fruits along with the miserable looking apple which is the only fruit offered. There is only one small elevator that serves both guests and staff so be prepared to wait a while if the hotel is full. Parking across the street is offered at a discount for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: montepink
Reviews.Content: Torturous beds - back/neck pain in the morning likely. The heating system shakes and roars like a rocket - difficult to sleep. The old, panting elevator totally inadequate (by the way, it shakes as it moves, and I don't think this is a good sign). The management has spent all the renovation budget money on the lobby and four busboys opening doors for you. I can open the door myself, thank you very much, and I don't care much about brass and marble in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Caitlin M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in their basic room during December 2011. Rude staff at front desk. Rooms were too hot (in winter). Only one lift in the entire hotel, so you have to wait over 5 mins for it. Overpriced. Only gave 1 star based on its amazing location - close to Macys, 5th Avenue and Penn station. Lot's of restaurants nearby, located in Korean Way.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a horrid experience...”
Reviews.Author: MarionBEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Sometimes the "Internet" lies! This hotel is only "modernized" as far as the lobby goes. The rooms are just old rooms camouflaged to hide all the flaws. The room we had had carpet over flooring that actualy sagged in places.(quite scary to walk on).The bathroom had a daily flood from the shower in the bathtub.The chips on the walls and floor were obvious. Repairs are needed.The beds were hard as rock and very uncomfortable. No amount of pillows helped. The service was not much better. English was not their forte. We asked for directions the night we were there and they could not help us. Although they did give us a map and told us to have a good day. All in all we paid alot of money for a really bad 3rd rate room.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: GalwayKilkennyDuo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Stanford Hotel for 4 nights - we had a junior suite with two large double beds, a 3 seater settee, a reclinig chair and a great flat screen TV. We paid $1170 including taxes etc for 4 people sharing for 4 nights. The rate also included breakfast which was nice jouce, coffee, bagels and doughnuts - enough to give you alift until you hit a nice diner for lunch. the staff were really helpfu and booked restaurants, cabs etc and always available to advise. The rooms were cleaned daily and were spotless. The bathroom could have had a little facelift but it was clean, large and functional. We were in the centre of the most exciting city in the world so who is staying in their room. For a really nice view hit the Marriott Marquis on Time Square and have a drink in the revolving lounge o nthe 48th floor. Get in before 8.00 p.m. and there is no cover charge, after that time ist $8 per person cover. We had lovely cocktails - about $14 and one of the best views in the world. We pre-booked the Ground Zero memorial garden and it was a very moving visit and very well managed. If you fancy a really nice lunch with fantastic views of the Brooklyn Bridge then head to Harbour Lights restaurant in Seaport /Pier 17. Great views and Tom the manager is very welcoming and the food was lovely. A great free trip is the Staten island Ferry - just head down to Battery Park and hop on the free Ferry for great views of the Statue of Liberty and the downtown skyline

Reviews.Title: “Eight women shopping in NYC”
Reviews.Author: alisonl45
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights, had stayed in the area before and like it. Our room had four people sharing and it was the biggest room I have ever stayed in in NYC, it was a junior suite and we could see the top of the ESB from the window. The beds were very comfortable and the room cleaned and beds changed every day. Our room was 1115 and would recommend it for three or four people. The hotel staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. Breakfast was bagels, pastries juice and apples. There is a bar and complimentary coffee, the bar is a bit dark but very handy for the last drink before bed. The location is perfect for Macy's and the ESB. There is a subway station on the corner. The area was very safe. My only complaint is the lift, we were on the 11th floor and there was only one lift so it took awhile to reach us. I will definitely stay here on my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for shopping”
Reviews.Author: DublinPolly08
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6 night stay at this hotel with friends. We booked the trip for shopping purposes and the Hotel was recommended to us by friends who had previously stayed there. We had a Junior suite between 3 and the space was wonderful, especially as the week progressed and the shopping bags increased.The staff were helpful and polite and the Hotel is perfectly located for shopping as is just across the road from Macy's.The area is busy and well lit so no worries if you have a night out and are coming home in the early hours.I would strongly recommend this Hotel to all shoppers and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: hattied
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and got it for a great price. It has an amazing location in New York and is a 5 minute walk from Times Square. The staff were friendly but weren't very knowledgable of the area when we asked where they recommended for places to eat or bars. The rooms are basic but are clean and safe which is the main thing in New York as you're not going to be spending time at your hotel! Had to queue for breakfast though when the hotel is busy which is a bit of a downside. Don't expect much with the complimentary breakfast but it keeps you going for a few hours! I would definetely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location and superb staff”
Reviews.Author: pamela14826
Reviews.Content: We had an executive suite for 1 night. Location was excellent with the subway next door and Madison Square Garden and Penn Station just a block away. The room was obviously old but was well maintained. The bathroom was new and clean and the bedding was clean and fresh. The staff was always friendly, knowledgable, and willing to help. I would stay there again. I do wish they had coffee makers in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel but a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: Clarise40
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good cental position so easy to get to all place of interest. It is in the korean district so the street is a bit shabby. The rooms are stuffy and hot and also shabby with broken chairs wardrobe doors and air con. Bed was clean and comfy but no tea or coffee making facilities in the room this was a problem for me. I did expect better from the reviews I had read. we booked suite and was a bit dissapointed There is a nice lounge bar on the second floor where rereshments are free during the day and you can buy a drink on the evening. There are a couple of PCs so you can use the internet. but no free wifi The breakfast was limited and a bit crowded although I always managed to find a seat. Staff was friendly enough and gave us recommendation of where to eat good korean food which is worth trying if you hav'nt had it before. Its a good base for exporing NYC but thats about it dont expect luxury so a bit pricey really

Reviews.Title: “No frills but good basic alrounder”
Reviews.Author: Luc1jar2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of october, staff very friendly and helpful. Cafe breakfast lovely, hotel worth the money for sheer location, very clean and tidy. Value for money it's not the Hilton but we didn't pay for that!

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect too much”
Reviews.Author: KWEST13
Reviews.Content: The only real advantage of Stanford hotel is its location. It is unique part of NY where you live in the middle of Korean community with plenty of Korean restaurant. The subway is just next to the hotel and those who want to shop have Macyâ€™s in distance of 150 m. The rest is definitely worse that one could expect after visiting their website. Room we had was small, dark and worn-out. Though during reservation we asked for room with nice view we got room with practically no view. It was impossible to guess what is the current weather. We had to use light the whole day, so dark was the room. Breakfast which is included in the price is joke not a breakfast. You are given plastic tray and plastic knife and could choose between small bagels, medium bagels and large bagels. Plus Philadelphia cheese and jam (in small plastic boxes of course). They advertise happy hours in their â€œWine Bar & Loungeâ€� and offer 50% off for beer, glass wine and â€œwell drinksâ€�. I still do not know what the latter means. When asked why I had to pay for single Makerâ€™s Mark $14 I got known that it is not eligible. So I guess Makerâ€™s Mark is not â€œwell drinkâ€�. To sum up â€“ I definitely do not recommend this â€œboutiqueâ€� hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: Lorilee86
Reviews.Content: Located in korea town literally a block from macys and 2 streets from penn station, walk to end of street turn right and you have the empire state building! Down points - Lobby was very dated(chunks of wood missing from rim of check in desk), only one elevator very slow also, curtins very dirty in room and towels had raggy ends, double room was very pokey more like a cheap b&b then hotel, breakfast consists of few donuts and tea coffee! Plus points - Location, room cleaned every day fresh sheets and towels if required, safe in room, free tea and coffee served between 3 and 5 every day in there wine bar, free internet/wifi on 2nd floor! all in all would i stay here again... if the price was right maybe at a push but would def try get better value for my money which would be hard in newyork!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and wifi is a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: J L
Reviews.Content: I would normally have given this an average rating, but the wi-fi issues turned this into a poor experience. The rooms are basic - nothing special - but clean. Our room had no window to speak of, as it looked out through a tiny little six inch slat between buildings. The location is excellent, which, in New York, is critical. My big pet peeve is that each person had to purchase their own wi-fi access at $10 per day. We were 3 in the room so 3 people each with their own devices meant it was an additional $30 per day for wi-fi. The hotel outsources this service and the front desk people didn't seem to care much. Other hotels usually allow you to purchase wi-fi access (if it's not included already) for the use of the room, not per device. Free wi-fi on the second floor doesn't cut it.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Glenstravels
Reviews.Content: I'm actually in the hotel bar now waiting for taxi and just a few notes, this hotel is great, the location is superb, the hotel is very clean and nicely decorated, the breakfast is very good and rooms are very nice. We had the empire state building as our view from room! I just wanted to add this review as I honestly can't figure out why some people give it a bad review, I would recommend this hotel and would use again, forget you get what you pay for, this hotel is great for the money, you will enjoy a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “0/10! Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: Nick A
Reviews.Content: I am a pretty laid back traveler, but please let me tell you about my most recent travel experience with this hotel. Our first experience walking into the hotel, the doorman doesn't open the door or offer to help with the bags. After 45 minutes of standing at the counter (without a single person in cue to check in) we finally check in and are told by the man at the counter to go relax and enjoy a COMPLIMENTARY breakfast. We walk into the little cafe and fix our plates and sit down and within seconds we get kicked out of the little "restaurant" after being told that we aren't eligible for the free meal until the next morning (we were given the option to pay $10 per person). Okay, lets break down and summarize the entire stay and why you should stay here... The front desk service is substandard. The hotel staff are rude. The room smells. The bathroom smells like mold. The shower was dirty and water flow was terrible. The temperature was too warm in the room even after asking to lower it. Woken up by house keeping (with a do not disturb sign on the door). The "breakfast" was stale donuts and bagels. the lounge on the second floor...the coffee was nasty and Oreo cookies out were probably several days old. Needless to say... terrible experience. Do yourself a favor... pay a few more dollars and Enjoy yourselves elsewhere. Do not stay in this hotel. Okay, one positive thing to say.. the location was great. Walking distance to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Would not classify as a 'Boutique Hotel' as advertising would suggest”
Reviews.Author: Mark M
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel at short notice in NYC and at a reasonable price, and from the website this hotel looked ideal especially as I have a preference for boutique hotels whilst travelling. I was very disappointed that it did not live up to expectations. Whilst location is great, the room I stayed in was very outdated and a bit 'grubby'. It really could have done with a deep clean which it seemed, has not been done in years. I guess I should remember that you get what you pay for. The reception areas were also very uninviting and very dated with worn carpet up the stairs. I would not recommend this as a 'boutique hotel' as advertising and the website would suggest!

Reviews.Title: “good location, "budget" price - but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: the_vj
Reviews.Content: Hotel prices in NYC are out of this world, so Stanford, at 120 euro / night, is a budget option and perhaps needs to be judged in that context (for comparison - paying the same price for the same level of accommodation in Paris would mean 0 points and very, very angry review). Located in Korea Town, right between Macy's and Empire State Building, this is a good base for Manhattan exploration. Plenty of Asian restaurants and eateries around. Combine "cheap" hotel in good location and it is obvious this is a very busy place, and the two receptionists struggle a bit to handle the "traffic". The rooms are clean, but the furnishing is dated and has seen better days. The frequent use shows everywhere - from squeaky bed to door leaving a gap above the carpet, transferring any sound from the corridor directly to the room. The breakfast ("breakfast included" was advertised when I made the booking on the internet) was a joke - coffee in a plastic mug with plastic spoon, muffin on a plastic plate and a fruit. All in all some 5 dollars value. If they did not advertise breakfast and did not offer anything, I would actually give the hotel one more point in this review. But this way, certain expectations were simply not fulfilled. The recycling ideas apparently still have not reached the place either - coming from a country that prides itself for environmental approach to everything, I feel very uncomfortable by creating all that plastic trash from a single "breakfast".

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy, great location”
Reviews.Author: Reds0x0407
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in sept 11. Very spacious rooms for NY city. Very clean, comfortable beds, helpful staff and location is perfect. Macy's on your doorstep (also modell's for fellow sports geeks) great as a start point for whatever part of the city you want to explore. Can't say much about the breakfast, but it was free so no loss...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisfix
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel they told us that we were upgraded to a suite, at no extra cost for us. So we got a room with two twin beds, and an adjoining "living room" with a sofa and a chair. Room and bathroom were clean, and we enjoyed our stay! Location is great, subway at the corner, just a few minutes walk to Times Square. The hotel has free breakfast, but the waiting line was long, and the breakfast consisted of bagels, cup-cakes and white toast. So we only ate our breakfast there the first morning. You don't have to go far to find a place to eat, so that was ok with us. Not the most inexpensive hotel, but good value for the money. We'll definetely consider this hotel next time we go to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: Fam06
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine. The rooms look like they had been recently remodeled. We had a room with 2 twin beds. The beds were extremely comfortable. We couldn't control the temperature of our room with our thermostat (it didn't work), so the maintenance man had to do it from outside of our room, which was very inconvenient. The rooms were clean. Now breakfast was another issue. We wanted to grab a bagel and coffee and eat it in our room, but we were told it would be $10 if we took food to go. So, we had to wait almost twenty minutes to be seated. It was bagels, muffins and doughnuts. The food was okay, but not worth the wait. Overall, it was fine for 1 night. I don't think I'd stay again, but only because I wanted to be closer to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: loueylouey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location for shopping and proximity to landmarks such as the Empire State Building, across from Macys, right beside a subway station, and v close to Times Square. Rooms (Double) are small, but ideal, if your trip is once purely concentrated on shopping! Free breakfast which consists of juice, cereal, bagels and pastries, Tea and Coffee. Have stayed here a few times and Im sure I will again on my next trip to the Big Apple

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my trip to NYC with my four daughters!”
Reviews.Author: Nuppyw
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Stanford was perfect for my trip to NYC with my four daughters. We had a suite that provided plenty of room for five women and all of our luggage. I slept on the sofa that was long and quite comfortable. The girls said the beds were super comfortable. The bathroom was really nice offering both a shower and a separate bath tub. It was large with a nice big mirror. The hotel was located near the subway entrance and we were able to easily navigate the city from it. Breakfast was included each morning downstairs and was really good. They offered donuts, bagels, muffins and fruit as well as juice and coffee. The only negative with the breakfast was that we couldn't take anything from the dining area and one morning one of the girls wasn't able to go down with the rest of us and we wanted to take something up to her and couldn't. The only real drawback of this hotel was the elevator. There was only one and it was small and always in use. I took the stairs quite a few times and it wasn't bad coming down, but going up the stairs were a bit steep and tiring. The staff was very nice and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC for comfort, location and price. It is rather old but has been remodeled recently and they have done a good job with it. It is in the Korean section of NYC and was run by all Asians who were very friendly and helpful. It was the only hotel I found that allowed five in one room too which was a huge plus!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for your money”
Reviews.Author: Berks
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel for its location. It is in the middle of Manhattan, within a couple of blocks from the Times Square, Broadway shows, shopping attractions etc. The entrance to the subway is about 20 feet from the hotel, and it is about 10 minutes of walking distance from the Madison Square Garden and the Train Station. It is in the middle of Korean quarter filled with multiple Korean restaurants and stores. The hotel itself is not that great but it's good for its price. I spent most of the time outside of hotel enjoying New York City. Bed and bathroom were the only things I concerned about. Bathroom was clean. All appliances were working fine. Air conditioner was quite and cold enough to set a pleasant temperature in the room. The room itself (the queen size one) was dark and small, the TV model was old CRT but it worked fine. The very first night I arrived to the hotel my room was not available and they placed me in the King Size room instead, which was much bigger, newer and brighter. They called it "complimentary" thing. I thought that I will stay in that room but, unfortunately, the next morning they relocated me to my dark queen size room while I was on my business meeting. No complaints, anyway. The elevator in the building is old, small and slow. For those, who get breakfast - you will receive orange juice, hot water with some selection of teas and coffee, croissants, danishes, cookies. Not really a wide variety. The place is crowded in the morning. Final words - I will stay in this hotel again if my funds are limited. Bed and pillows were not comfortable :) Oh, there is no iron in the queen size room but there is one in the king size one. Forgot to mention one more thing - if room faces the street side - it is noisy, but bright. Otherwise, it's dark and quite. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location.”
Reviews.Author: SueLNorwich
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at this hotel. Before leaving I read a couple of terrible reviews for this hotel and I was a little concerned. However I experienced none of the criticisms levelled by these reviewers. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The room, a twin, was newly decorated and refurbished and was very clean. Towels and sheets were changed daily without problem. The rooms were well equipped with a fridge, a safe and there was plenty of storage space. It also had flat screen tv. The air conditioning was very effective and could be adjusted manually in the room. My only criticism was the room was a little dark with a view of a brick wall. However ,the room more than served its purpose. Breakfast was a little repetitive but tasty and filling. The food was never stale during our seven night stay. We did have to wait a few minutes on some days for a table but not for long. Complimentary coffee and biscuits were served in the bar until 3pm which was also helpful as the location made it possible to pop back with shopping or a break during the day. Free internet access on the 2nd floor was also great. We only occasionally had to wait for the lift but again only for a few minutes. The location was fantastic with easy access to the main sights . Overall this is an excellent 3 star hotel that is extremely good value. There are many hotels in the area but many cost significantly more than the hotel Stanford. True it is not the standard of a Marriot as one reviewer unfairly compared it with, but it doesn't pretend to be.It charges a lot less.i did consider staying at the Marriot with points I have but it still worked out about 60% more expensive. I was extremely happy with the Stanford and the price I paid. It was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't love it but it is conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: theptytraveler
Reviews.Content: Acommodations are a bit old fashioned but roomy, the breakfast buffet is limited - you have to go early or you'll end up empty handed. It is conveniently located near the subway and near many korean and asian restaurants

Reviews.Title: “really great location, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: littlekimms
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very clean, we had new towels everyday, the beds were great, the pillows the same. there is internet acces on the 2nd floor for free and payable in the rooms. printing is payable. the hotel is close to times square, macy's, 5th avenue, empire state building etc really easy to go, by foot, by metro or by bus. the breakfast was awful, only bakerys, very sweet and not baked enough. no fresh vegetables, eggs, cheese or anything.

Reviews.Title: “Sizzling location, hotel just ok”
Reviews.Author: Thiago_Rio
Reviews.Content: Could not have hoped for a better location, it was very close to the Empire State Building. Hotel was a bit overpriced, then. The hotel itself was average. Breakfast was mediocre, rooms just ok.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: brianfind
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor rating and price. Right at Broadway, steps to the subway. 15 blocks to Times Square takes 15 minutes to walk. Rooms are smallish but suited my 12 year old son and I fine with two single beds. TV could use a few channels, couldn't find the British Open on the channels provided!? The breakfast is a little chaotic as the room gets full quickly and you might have to wait. Bagels, juice, fruit coffee buffet style. Overall a good choice for economy travel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: KateTosh
Reviews.Content: Honest and clean hotel. But not free wi-fi in rooms. Small business center. Breakfast is ok, dont expect much. Unfortunately there's NO fitness center. Helpfull staff! Very good location in Midtown, close to subways and stores!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE hotel wasted on great location”
Reviews.Author: FunTravels03
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from July 14 for 4 nights. I chose this hotel because the reviews weren't GREAT, but they weren't bad either. For the cheap price and the location we decided to go for it. We booked a suite which had 2 queen beds and a sofa. I got charged extra tax because there was a "second" room and its considered a living room, but it really isn't. I just think they said there was tax and were really just taking our money. First off, when you go there the check in process is ridiculously slow. I got there around 1pm and they told me GUARANTEED check in time was 3pm and they were not done cleaning all the rooms so we understood and went out to grab lunch. We got back after eating and a brisk walk around 330pm and found that the room was still not ready. They told us it would be ready in 10 minutes so we went to the bakery next door for some coffee and snacks. We came back and sat in their "lobby" which is tiny until about 4pm. My wife was already annoyed that the GUARENTEED check in time was 3pm and we werent even in the room at 4pm. ONE HOUR LATER! We were frustrated and then had to wait another 15 minutes for ONE ELEVATOR to get taken to the 9th floor. Terrible choice of 1 elevator. (This posed a problem for us everyday waiting about 15 minutes and stopping at every floor going up and down). When you walk into the room, the room had a rustic old smell. It had a nice flat screen tv, but the covers were old and the carpet looked like it hadn't been properly cleaned for months which seems quite disgusting. The room temperature is a problem since they have "central air conditioning system"?! Whenever we asked the front desk to lower the temperature.... nothing happened. After awhile we just gave up and bought a fan for the room on the 2nd night. I also asked for water and it was delivered 1 hour later after which I had already gone out and bought it from a small convenient store next door. We encountered bed bugs on the 3rd night after one of my children had bites up her leg. After mentioning this to the front desk, they told us everything is alright because they do weekly bed bug sprays by a professional. We politely asked for new sheets or a room change and they forgot. After asking a few more times around 11pm they finally brought it up, meanwhile WAKING us up. It felt like they forgot and remembered later on in the night which was really rude. The front desk staff is nice and friendly, but their service is slow. A couple days the housekeeping didn't clean our rooms and they claimed we had "Do Not Disturb" signs on our doors. In reality we lost that sign on the 1st night and we desired room service each day we were out, so that was strange. The bellman on the otherhand are rude men asking for tips when they bring new towels and sheets to us. The bellman named Miguel just snatched our bags when we were trying to leave and directing us to a cab when we didn't need one. He insisted and argued with me briefly while leaving my bag on the steps and storming back inside. However, there is one bellman named Edward and he was a fine gentleman. Outside the hotel he helped direct us to a nice restaurant he liked nearby. Also he helped bring up some amenities on Saturday night and asked us politely if we needed anything else or if anything was needed to be adjusted. Very polite and gentlemanlike. OVERALL, my stay was not pleasant at all. The location is perfect, but the hotel is anything from perfect. Like the title says, TERRIBLE hotel wasted on a great location. If you have no other location to go to, then go here. Other than that I would choose another hotel. We saw quite a few others down the block too.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay there -- Worst place in my life list”
Reviews.Author: cp8290
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Korean Village. that was not a problem. I would say for the price i paid by the time i got to my room i was giving a second thought. When i entered the room it had old smell. Looked at the carpet and felt dirty where i did not want to walk bear foot. I at least had my socks on the whole time. Since the room was worm i put the thermostat at 65 degrees and the temp in the room never went below 70 degrees. When i looked at the base boards they looked like something was splashed all over. As I try to settle down in the room i went to the bathroom and lets say it was not at par at all. Toilet shook as you sat on it. There was no place to put toiletry, I had to put it on the dresser in the bedroom. Looked in the tiny closet that had 4 hangers there was no Iron. So when i asked for an Iron they brought one with an ironing board. When i tried to open the ironing board it was rusted and it opened about two feet of the ground. I was better off ironing on the bed. Oh by the way in the whole room there was one plug accessible under the desk. No other plugs in the room at all. So then when i returned in the evening there i pulled the sheets back and there was long hair in the bed. Asked them to bring new sheets and it never showed up. i basically slept on top of the bed and also removed two pillows of the bed because 1 had blood stain and 1 had some kind of stain. I did not put my head on the other two pillows. I made sure the pillows were covered with the sheets and slept that way. Next morning Continental breakfast was covered so went to the little restaurant in the lobby and was greeted with an attitude. i had to wait in line to get really crappy coffee, hard donuts, and dry as heck muffins on a paper plate and plastic utensils. Lets say i did not eat the continental breakfast there again. I got way better food from the street vendor. Lucky for me i was not in the room for the whole day the next day and spent just one another night and even though i had told two house maids about the sheets and pillows they still were not changed for the second night. Third day i had a life saver friend who said I was checking out and she put me in the Midtown Marriott with her Marriott Rewards point. I checked out of this pace a day early and the front desk had nothing to say but sorry you are leaving us. I even gave them the survey left in the room. Front desk had a young kid so he did not give a rats behind. I basically paid for a day/night i did not use. To anyone who reads this review I would say Please think twice and do not stay @ this place unless you are desperate. There are plenty of hotels around it that i would have stayed at any day.

Reviews.Title: “Can't really complain!”
Reviews.Author: hayleymcbayley
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in Hotel Stanford from 6th-13th June 2011. First impression was good, and honestly my impression stayed the same the whole time. Our room had two single beds in which were really comfortable, we had a TV which was great for when we'd come back from a long day and it was very clean. We stayed for 7 nights and the last morning, when I went to get in the shower there were some little bugs that had come up the plug hole. We phoned reception and within minutes 4 people came up to inspect and sorted it out straight away. I don't blame the hotel for this at all and we had our whole room inspected for bed bugs. etc and there was nothing, thank goodness. The lift (elevator) wasn't that great and it was quite small, I have a fear of them anyway and hadn't got in one for 6 years so I'm naturally nervous in them! It never broke down though so I was happy! As for the free breakfast, I can't comment on that because EVERY morning we missed it, oops. The location of this hotel was PERFECT. Just around the corner from Macy's, Empire State, Victoria's Secret. etc etc - 10/15 minute walk to Times Square. 5/10 minute walk to Madison Square Garden. We didn't once have to get the subway to where we wanted to go, we only got a taxi three times, which happened to be the hottest day of the year (102 degrees, it was so humid!) and we couldn't bare to walk as the heat was too much. No, this hotel wasn't amazing, but aside from one or two not so great things, it was really good for my friend and I's stay. When you're in New York, you don't really use your hotel for much more than sleeping anyway. I would definitely recommend. Thank you Hotel Stanford. P.S Free wifi would be great ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad12419
Reviews.Content: A great value at a great location great staff nice bar overall a real find

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: TrevJan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stanford a couple weeks before Christmas last year for 3 nights, we had a suite which was ideal for two couples, and it proved to be very cost effective way for two couples to visit NY. Although the hotel shows signs of being a bit tired and in need of some TLC, this is reflected in the cost of accomadation. The location was ideal for sightseeing, Empire State Building just round the corner, Times Square & Macys easy walking distance. We chose to have breakfast each morning at Speedys on Greeley Square., superb food and service, just a few mins walk from hotel. The only complaint that I do have, is that whilst waiting in the lobby for our transfer to JFK, we all had to visit the toilets at the back of the lobby area, they were disgusting and I certainly feel let the hotel down - "First impressions go along way" so we were very pleased that we didn't need to use these toilets on arrival, as it would of certainly put us off of staying here. I hope the hotel if they haven't already refurbished the toilets by now, take my constructive comments on board. We would certainly have no hesitation in staying at the "Stanford" on our next trip to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal In Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: ingrid_pariss
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Sanford for a night. I found a deal at the last minute (actually the same day). The hotel is well located, close to subway, malls, restaurants and attractions (Times Square, Empire State Building in a walking distance). While the room was small, it was clean and quiet. The only problem I had was that you cannot control the A/C so during the night it was making a loud noise, it was hard to sleep. Other than that, I enjoyed my night there, especially the breakfast :-) No free internet, but there are cafes around where you can get it for free.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: 13whiterabbit
Reviews.Content: Whilst the cleanliness, location and price are reasonable for new york - the service was absolutely the worst I've experienced on any trip. Checking in the attendant was rude and unhelpful. Despite the fact I emailed in advanced and asked if they accepted a travel card (and they said yes) - she automatically declined my card - leaving me quite high and dry without any options as I loaded the card with enough to pay for the hotel. When I pressed her into trying it barely took 5 minutes - so clearly she just wasn't bothered to try in the first place. The whole time she was checking us in she was also giggling and laughing with a co-worker instead of paying any attention to us. On check out the attendant stopped half way to attend to someone else despite me telling him that we had a connecting train to catch (we gave at least half hour to just check out - but we still missed our train) He was extremely unhelpful, and made a huge fuss to just print us out a receipt to show that our card was declined (Most places I've encountered will provide you with a declined receipt, without question, to prove no transactions occurred) Also our drain in our shower was clogged so after a minute the tub would fill up with mildewy water. Avoid this place if you can

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: acs106
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights. The hotel is nothing fancy, but it is very clean and comfortable. It will probably be the smallest hotel you'll stay in in your life, probably around 12x11, not including the bathroom for a Queen room, but that's all you need in NYC. The location is perfect; in between Broadway and 5th Avenue on 32nd, 2 blocks from Penn Station, less than a block from a metro station on the yellow line and a 15 minute walk to Times Square. They also have computer access until 11pm if you need it on the second floor and they provide free continental breakfast until 10am. Don't expect much from the breakfast - bagels, apple fritters, apples, doughnuts, coffee, oj, water, black tea and milk. My only complaint was the bed since it felt almost the same as sleeping on a sofa bed pull-out, but it wasn't too bad. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrMikey24
Reviews.Content: The hotel Stanford is a pleasant if basic hotel in a decent midtown location. The rooms are very small for New York (but reasonable compared to European cities) but clean and ours had a view of the empire state building if you tilted your neck the right way. TV had lots of stations and it was quiet with a comfortable bed. Location wise youâ€™re a block from Macys and lots of mid town shops. Itâ€™s also right next to lots of bus and subway lines so transport is always easy. Free breakfast is a massive plus. In most hotels at this budget there is either no breakfast or you pay quite a premium for it. The choice is a little odd, generally there are muffins donuts, tea, coffee and orange juice and a few pastries. Not perfect but not bad at all for free. There is a cafÃ© metro just around the corner too if you fancy something a little more substantial. The atrium and lift is probably the biggest letdown. On first arrival it really has a bit of a cheap feel to it, which is a shame because it could be much more. Iâ€™ve stayed in 5 3* midtown hotels and to be honest it ranks towards the bottom. But that isnâ€™t to say there is much wrong with it. Pros: Reasonable location, good price, free breakfast, clean, quiet Cons: Looks dated, basic, not the best part of midtown

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at NYC”
Reviews.Author: Guli G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good place to stay in NYC, and very central. 10 minutes walking from times square and less then 30 seconds from subway. The breakfast is a big plus in my opinion. we paid 200$ (including tax) for twins room for thursday to monday (memorial weekend) Don't expect to luxury hotel or something near, it's just a traveler hotels. Three problems: 1. Central Air Conditioner, so it's didn't cool our room enough, and friends' room that stayed one floor above us was freezed to death. 2. One elevator (and not so big) and 12 floors, in the rush hours (morning) you can expect to wait 5 minutes for the elevator. so maybe request lower floor (for example floor 3). but I don't know what's about the noise in lower floors as we stayed in floor number 11. 3. WIFI for free only avialble at the loby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would not mind going back!”
Reviews.Author: trixiewoods
Reviews.Content: -This hotel is situated in a very nice location where shops and landmarks are very close-by. For the people who love to shop, Macy's, Victoria Secret, H&M and Zara (to name a few) are all on the same block! The park is walking distance (20 blocks is a long walk but a very nice one for the people who like to visit by foot ;)) and it is also a prime location to walk to Chelsea, West Village, East Village (Food) and Soho (Shopping) since it is situated almost in the middle of everything interesting! -The staff there is very nice and helpful and Ron (one of the doorman) is a complete sweet heart whose smiles and chit-chats were always a good encounter. -We ate the breakfast from the hotel once and it was nothing special, as expected, and the line was quite long, so my family and I went to Pax which is between 35th and 36th street on 6th avenue and had amazing breakfast. It's a nice option from the usual hotel food (bagel (I'm from Montreal so I didn't even dare trying any of the bagels :P) , muffins, orange juice and coffee..) -And last but not least, the ROOM! It was okay; clean, smelled good and my family and I were the only tenants ;). We had no view and the rooms are very outdated but we were barely there so we didn't care. In a nutshell, if you care about looks and really want a view, don't go to Stanford (or room 210) and try a more posh hotel (or another room). We personally enjoyed the location a lot more than the room itself and I think that's the whole point of going to New York City. They also have their own lounge which looks very, very cute and their mojitos are really good. Stanford Hotel gives you what you want: a cheap stay, great location, breakfast and a clean, satisfactory room. The service is great, the hotel guests aren't obnoxious and in my book it is a very respectful establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Area”
Reviews.Author: Keyla24k
Reviews.Content: The Hotel its just OK but needs some upgrade, I stay in the 12 Floor and the elevator wasn't working, The room was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for the unfussy guest”
Reviews.Author: PH_Lar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Stanford for five nights at the end of April 2011. There were four of us in total, in two twin rooms. Price: Firstly as regards price, it was the best I could find for that time of the year in a central location and which met our needs. We all know how expensive hotels are in the general Manhattan area and on location alone for five nights, we got quite a good deal. Rooms: We booked two twin rooms. We got rooms on the 3rd & 8th floors. Both rooms were identical. Each room had two single beds, desk, walk in wardrobe with safe and bathroom. The room wasnâ€™t massive, but was quite spacious for our needs and a lot bigger than I had anticipated from reading previous stories of NY hotel rooms. The beds were comfortable. Bathroom was moderate size and had a bath with shower attached. Bathroom could do with a bit of cleaning around tiles, etc, but wasnt bad. Room had a nice flat screen TV on the wall, radio alarm clock, fridge. There was no view from the room, just of an adjoining building next door, but a view is not something I had anticipated in central Manhattan. My biggest flaw with the room was the air conditioning. There was a temperature control switch on the wall, but the actual air vent seemed to not work. There was no air coming from it at all. Then on our 3rd day there, it suddenly seemed to start working fine, but only for that day, as it then ceased blowing air again! The room wasnâ€™t overly warm or cold, but I would have liked the A/C to be working as meant too. Staff: Staff seemed friendly and helpful when needed. The door staff were helpful in organising taxiâ€™s. CafÃ© staff, room cleaners, all friendly. Overall no problems here. Breakfast: There is complementary breakfast from 7am-10am in the Ele cafe which is situated just off the hotel lobby. The breakfast consists of Coffee, juice, bagels, muffins, doughnuts, pastries of all sort really. It certainly isnâ€™t your conventional type breakfast, but isnâ€™t bad to get the day started with before finding something more substantial out on the street. One thing I found most mornings was a queue. There isnâ€™t a huge amount of seating in the cafe and guest have to queue up until a table comes free, so one can be waiting on average 5 - 10mins. Staff in the cafe were very friendly and we got to know the man handing out the trays each morning well during our stay. General: The hotel has a "business centre" on the second floor, which consists of two computers and the internet. Its free to use and is handy for checking mails, etc. There is also free WI-FI in this area, but only until 3pm, then there is a charge. Beside the business centre, there is a wine bar. It serves coffee during the day I think and wine/drink until 1 or 2am I believe. Check out time from the hotel is 12pm, but there is a baggage store in the main lobby where the door man will lock away bags for later collection, which is handy when catching a late flight. To sum up, the hotel is in a great location. It certainly isnâ€™t anything fancy, but does the job well and has everything one should need. For someone who just wants a room for the night and is going to be out and about all day, then the Stanford fits the bill 100%. If you want pampering and that little bit more, then maybe look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pignetta
Reviews.Content: excellent position, good value for money. The hotel lies few meters from the metro "Herald Square". Helpful staff at the reception. Good continental breakfast :) free internet till the 3 p.m. I travel with 3 friends and we have a comfortable "juonior suite", 2 double beds and a sofa. The last 2 mornings we have breakfast just 10 minutes before closing time and the staff was very kind!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, and this hotel is reasonably cheap.”
Reviews.Author: NormOfAlbania
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced hotel walking distance from Penn Station. Helpful check-in staff and friendly service by New York standards. Bedroooms have tired decor, but comfortable beds and decent showers - you should always expect to get what you pay for. I've no real complaints about the hotel, the location is good and we didn't pay much for our 4 nights here, I did feel slightly dissapointed by the breakfast "buffet" of stale breads and coffee - you'd be better off going to a nearby Deli for something delicious instead. Liked 32nd streets Koreatown scene also, some excellent shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Evanka162
Reviews.Content: Myself and two family members stayed in this hotel last year for 10nights and had a wonderful stay. The location is excellent, just around the corner from Macy's. We found all the staff friendly and very helpful. On that trip we ended up moving rooms half way through our trip, both rooms were large, modern and clean, thus the reason we decided to return to the Hotel Stanford again this year. Sadly the same could not be said for our room this year, we were put in a twin room facing out onto a brick wall. Now i know you dont go to New York to stay in your room so the wall outside our window wasnt a major issue for us, however the room and especially the bathroom looked like it could do with a good clean/lick of paint etc , in saying all of that the shower was very powerful which helped the situation. We found the beds were very comfortable which was also a bonus but i thought it was a bit strange that the duvets didnt have covers on them only sheets wrapped around them!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, perfect!”
Reviews.Author: jpsNYCfan
Reviews.Content: We visited New York for the second time in September 2010 and stayed here, the Hotel Stanford which is situated in the Korean District. However, only 2 minutes away from Herald Square. Macy's is about a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The service was exceptional, rooms really clean and tidy, all the mod cons. Bathroom was superb. Very spacious and light. Bed's where comfortable, but I have slept in better. But you don't really do alot of sleeping in NY anyway, you're so busy taking in the sights you quickly lose track of time. On the first floor there is a lovely coffee lounge which is open from, I believe, 10-3pm every day and then it becomes a bar at night. Breakfast is served downstairs in the cafe/deli just off of the lobby, complimentry bagles, dounuts, muffins and a variety of teas, coffee and juices are served from 7am-10am every morning. Just a short walk, around 10 minutes from Times Square, 2 minutes to Herald Square, 2 minutes to the Empire State Building and a short walk through to Bryant Park make this a prime location to stay at. Not the greatest of value, but still great with friendly staff and the people of Little Korea are very friendly and lively. I reccomend it for people who are staying in the city for the first time, simply because of it's fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not the best value for money wise however”
Reviews.Author: ODN67
Reviews.Content: We paid nearly $400 per night for 5 nights for two queen beds and a sofa. The room itself was fine and the bathroom was clean and the beds comfortable. Problem was we had no air flow through one of the AC vents. About 3 times someone tried to fix it. After the first time we simply asked for a fan to circulate some air. Each time, instead of a fan, we had someone else knock on the door advising they would fix the AC, at which point, I felt compelled to tip them. End result, they didn't fix the vent, slowed down the air flow of the vent in the lounge area and took a day and a half and several requests to get the fan. The free breakfast (yes, I know 'what do you expect for free?') was inedible. We tried the first morning and opted to buy breakfast elsewhere instead. The hospitality staff were friendly. The desk staff did not really look up to recognise people as they came in and out but were fine if directly spoken to. The doorman was helpful and waited with us outside when waiting for a early shuttle in the dark upon our departure. As others have said, the area feels very safe and is in close proximity to a lot of shopping and the subway, and of course the magnificent Empire State Building. We were out until after midnight every night we were there so we only needed somewhere to sleep but felt we could have got more value for what was the most expensive accommodation on our 7 city vacation. We may very well be in for a rude shock when we try other places when we return to New York, but we were dissatisfied enough to take the chance and try somewhere else next time. I am not writing off the Stanford to others however as we probably just got unlucky with the AC and it is a quaint enough New York style Hotel. As an aside, we love New York, love the sights, the sounds, the vibe. We can not wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money, absolutely.”
Reviews.Author: cmkelly1946
Reviews.Content: It's an older hotel that has been nicely renovated. The rooms are small but comfortable and considering the location, centrally located in lower Manhattan, the place is a great value. This ain't no day spa, it's true, but the staff is courteous and responsive and the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, comfortable room, good breakfast but a few of the reception staff need to remember the custormer service.”
Reviews.Author: ardentspur
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel we had read some so so reviews but decided that there were more fors than against. The room was not huge but certainly big enough for my grown up daughter and myself. There was a good sized wardrobe come cupboard with a safe inside. The room also had a fridge a real advantage to us as my daughter has to eat gluten free and after we had found the green gourmet 790 Lexington avenue we were able to stock up. She could not eat the breakfast but I enjoyed the very free large muffin or variety of doughnuts with orange juice and coffee. The apples looked very bruised so gave them a miss. I never had to wait for a seat and found the staff helpful and friendly. The check in was efficient and the duty manager helpful. One young lady was quite sharp, unhelpful and did not listen to our request when booking the return trip to the airport. She should not be in the hotel business. The hotel is easy working from Macy's, Maddison Square Garden, and a not too far walk up Broadway to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: jromano_br
Reviews.Content: We went to NY city to spend just one week. A few months before our trip we started to look for a cheap place in the city to stay in Manhattan and as everybody knows, Manhattan is known to be one of the cities with the most expensive hotel prices in the world. A friend of mine who has just stayed in this hotel indicated it to me and I went to check it out in the internet. Good price, very well located: from the front door you can see the 5th av; about less than 15 minutes by walking is Times Square; two blocks behind there's a Victoria`s Secret store and the 34th street is near to the hotel since it`s located in the 32nd street , in Koreantown, plus Empire State Building is about 5 minutes by walking. The room was nice, a good bed, a table with 2 chairs, water to drink and a good wardrobe. Everyday when we came from our daily tour to our room it was cleaned and all items as well as soap, shampoo and towels were replaced as we use them. There's a very simple breakfast (black coffe, juices, bagels, donuts and something else that I can remember now) but if you are considering saving money it`s a good option. Now if you are looking for confort, big bathroon and etc... don't stay in this hotel probrably in Manhattan there's a place that will be suitable for your necessity.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere Else !”
Reviews.Author: casimir_7
Reviews.Content: Very disapointing, the hotel cost us around $290AUD per night, breakfast was not worth having, staff were beyond caring, room was tiny and not very clean. Position was not too bad, fairly central. I know this is New York and New York is the most expensive place to stay but I'm sure with a bit more study and checking any travellers should be able to get better value for money than we did ! I would not recommend the Stanford

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel in a great location for an NYC shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: LuluLimerick
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Stanford for five nights in December 2010. Went with a girlfriend for a shopping trip, the location of the Hotel Stanford is great, we were surrounded by great stores, just a 3 min walk to Macys and the hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. As it was my birthday and my friend mentioned that on our reservation, a bottle of wine was left in my room which was a really nice touch. Never had breakfast in the hotel so can't comment on that! The only tiny negative was that our room was very warm, almost stuffy, I had to sleep with the window open and ask for the heating to be turned down. But yup, would stay here again. The beds are also very comfortable, the shower's good and there's free internet access which is handy to check the bank balance after all that shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good”
Reviews.Author: BenitoDelicias
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days and got the suite because we needed a hotel room that could fit our family of 4 adults, and we couldn't find another hotel in the city that had at least two double beds and some space to walk or put suitcases on the floor. Considering the size of the room, the location, the bathroom (it was wheelchair accesible, that's the reason why it was so big), the free muffins and bagels every morning and again, the location!, the price was very reasonable. And the hotel had a ton of ongoing promotions so we got a nice price. The hotel looks very small from the outside but somehow the manage to make it big inside. The hallways might be tiny but our suite was big and I saw a double room that had an open door and it looked nice too. The room was clean, had a nice tv, nice furniture, comfortable beds, huge bathroom, very clean, nice shower, everything was just great. Decoration in both the hotel common areas and the rooms were also very very good. I would definitely recomment it. There are a million stores around the hotel and it's a close walk to Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, a subway station is right there, Gap, Forever 21, H&M, Banana Republic, the huge Macys is around the corner, Manhattan Mall, cafes, restaurants, delis, comic book stores and Empire State is basically behind the hotel. And if you didn't plan very well, there are a countless free flyers, maps and guides in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: SabineMarie2112
Reviews.Content: Hotel Stanford is located in Korea Town, close to Harold Sq (Macy's) and the Empire State Building - a fabulous location for exploring NY on foot. The rooms are small, but big enough for two people because you are only there to sleep. Cleaniless of the rooms: it was ok; when we arrived we found black hairs underneath the mattress (we were checking for bed bugs, but had none) and that shocked me; but from then on, the bed was clean, the bathroom was clean. The complimentary breakfast is very sweet, but they offer fruity muffins and small apples as well; the coffee is, in my opinion, not drinkable, but they offer tea as well. If you do not want to spend too much money on hotels, you could go there; I am not sure if I would go there again. One reason is that they cheated us with their hotel taxi. We had to go to LaGuardia Airport from there and ask them if they could get us a taxi. They offered the hotel taxi instead for a fixed price of 45 dollars (plus bridge toll and tip) and told us this is the regular price - which it NOT true. Since it was our first time in NYC, we believed them and took it. However, when we took a yellow cab back from LaGuardia to Manhattan a couple of days later, we experienced that it is much cheaper (about 27 dollars). So this was disappointing!!! This is also one reason why I ranked the service as poor.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel for business travel, perhaps for a cheap shopping vacation”
Reviews.Author: Travel_And_Tell
Reviews.Content: I came to NYC for 2 nights for business, and based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, I chose Hotel Stanford for the location near my client as well as the price (within my per diem budget). This was NOT what I expected from the reviews. The carpet had stains on it, the bed was extremely wobbly, the furniture had dust and hair on it and the TV was extremely outdated as was the decor. Paint was peeling and it looked like the chain lock on the door had been replaced at least three times. I must not have gotten one of the "updated" rooms; I was in room #1014 and the musty smell gave me a headache. I was nervous to take my socks off or get under the covers (which the room did not even have a comforter)... and I am a traveller who is comfortable staying in hostels and budget hotels! I would MAYBE consider this for someone looking for a cheap hotel in a good location... because the location was great... but I moved on my second night to the nearby DoubleTree for just $100 more a night. To me it was worth it. Cannot comment on the breakfast because I didn't stay long enough. You get what you pay for and even though $200 a night seems like a lot to some people, apparently it doesn't pay for much in NYC. Not according to my experience at this hotel. A pro was that it was fairly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, spacious room, though not specially cheap”
Reviews.Author: Pascaleh
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised of the spaciousness of the room, which included a nice sitting area with a couch and a chair. Bathroom was roomy as well and had a window. Didn't expect so much room in NYC! As we were going to arrive late, 11pm, I had emailed the hotel to request a couple of things (more pillows and a room close to the elevator), and both requests answered positively. The hotel is centrally located off of 32nd and Broadway in the garment district, just one block away from the Empire State Building. Quite convenient. Service was great, bed was comfortable and the staff was very helpful. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast in the small deli/bakery shop next door, and that is one of their opportunity. Not much as far as breakfast. Only danishes, bagels and cream cheese. No jam or muffins or toasts. When I inquired with the front desk, they were very apologetic and shared that they do place their order for breakfast every Monday for the week, so it wouldn't have been possible for them to accommodate our request. They were kind enough to send two free drinks coupons for their Wine Lounge, a nice gesture. A couple of nights later, we ended taking advantage of them and had a drink in the Wine 1986 lounge. Nice dark decor and very friendly staff. Not a lot of people though, just a few other customers. The hotel also offers a business center, where you can use the internet. Overall we were pretty happy with it, though it was on the high end of our budget: we paid almost $1400 for 5 nights. Oh and the one thing I would offer is free wireless internet. It was $10 per day or $35 for 5 days. But let's face it, NYC is expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room Size”
Reviews.Author: LizinCo
Reviews.Content: My friend and I met my adult son in New York in November, 2009, to see shows, tour the city, see the Rockettes, etc. This hotel is located about 2 blocks from Macy's and we walked to many sites -- Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Fifth Avenue, the subway. We stayed in a junior suite -- two queen beds, a lovely bathroom, and a good size sitting room. My only minor complaint was the quality of the included breakfast. However, there is an adjoining bakery, so I was able to buy better pastries in the mornings to round out the breakfast. I would definetly stay here again. Don't be put off when you hear it is in the Korean district.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed Hotel Stanford.”
Reviews.Author: AshgroveHouse
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff so helpful and considerate. Room was really lovely. Thank you Jack and Erwin. Did you find my earring?

Reviews.Title: “peace and quiet in the shadow of the empire state building”
Reviews.Author: stealingsouls
Reviews.Content: being slightly nervous because this was my first real solo trip, and only my second time to new york (first time was almost 8 years ago) i was happy to find that hotel was very close to penn station and not at all creepy. you can tell they are slowly revamping the rooms. the bathrooms are quite nice looking (a friend of mine stayed in the hotel as well and had a fancy glass shower with rain fall shower head) but the rest of the interior is hit or miss. the room is quite spacious for a new york hotel room (last time i was in NYC the room was comically small, tv on top of dresser, dresser draws wouldn't open all the way because they almost hit the bed and bathroom door just barely missed the end of the bed), and it was nice that there was a fridge. despite being near the supply closet i had a great night sleep all the nights that i was there. i didn't get to try the bar or the free breakfast but it looked okay. everything seemed clean, and while not in the most fashionable of places, it's pretty good location for getting other places (there's a subway enterance near by and if you are a great walker you can easily walk to things). i do know that while i wasn't lucky enough to get one, some rooms do have flat screen tvs. all i really wanted in a hotel was someplace close to the train station so i wouldn't have to haul my luggage too far, someplace easy to get to no matter where i went, someplace clean, and someplace where i could get a good night sleep and not have to worry about someone busting into my room in the middle of the night. hotel stanford hit all points.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: ddl8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Labor Day weekend and loved how convenient it was to Penn Station, which was one of the reasons we chose it. The room was very small and the bed felt a bit small to me as well but was very clean and considering we were only there to sleep it was perfectly fine for our purposes. There's a mini fridge, you have to pay for wireles internet, and the breakfast is a pretty simple affair consisting of a choice of donuts, bagels and muffins but overall, for the convenience and location it fit the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: StevePal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the start of our first trip to the US. Although not the cheapest hotel we could find (well not bad for New York!) it was a really pleasant place. The room was quite small, but adequate, and very clean, just like the rest of the hotel. Staff were always attentive, and sorted out our only problem, when our key card refused to work repeatedly. The location? One block from the Empire state Building, in between Penn and Grand Central Stations - perfect. Al in all, a recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but average quality”
Reviews.Author: Constantine-TA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Stanford on July 31-August 2, 2010. Location is great - 2 blocks away from Penn Station and less than a block away from the 34th street subway stop. People who said rooms were small were not kidding. Our room was VERY small - so small that we both couldn't really be up at the same time. Not comfortably anyway. Ditto for bathroom - shower only (good pressure though) and a very small sink, not enough towels. However, we were just there to sleep, so it wasn't a big problem. Poor air conditioning, however, was a problem and we had to call reception to activate cold air in the room. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast is very basic and get there early as the restaurant fills up quickly. That said, it's New York - plenty of cheap breakfast places around the corner. Hotel was relatively clean. Staff were pleasant. That's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: las1085
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT location right off the block next to Union Sq and maybe 15 yds from the subway. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and accommodating. The two major problems we had with our room were that the two windows faced directly into another building (maybe 18 inches away?), so even in the afternoon there was almost zero natural light, and if I thought too much about it I'd get a little claustrophobic. Secondly, it was December and the heat in our room was non-existent. It was freezing. The hotel did their best to keep us warm with two space heaters (we put one in the ice cold bathroom w/ a draft and kept one in the room) The room was warm enough eventually, but I questioned the safety of keeping it on all night long at the time. However, I would still recommend staying here, giving the hotel the benefit of the doubt that it was a fluke in our room only at the time.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: hsvtrip
Reviews.Content: Although I got a decent rate, the service and accommodations at Hotel Stanford were less than expected based on the other reviews that I had seen. The hotel is not on the cleanest of streets. On a positive note, the subway is very convenient. The room was clean and quaint. Don't be taken in by the "complimentary breakfast". The breakfast consists of stale donuts and pastries, orange juice, milk, and coffee. The first morning there was mold on two of the donuts. Needless to say, we didn't return for breakfast. The temperature in our room could not be controlled from inside the room. We had to call the front desk to have the temperature adjusted.
