On three of the four nights we stayed, wash clothes were not left in our room....we had to phone the front desk to have them brought to the room. There is only one elevator in the hotel that serves 12 floors. Fortunately, we were on the fourth floor so we resorted to using the stairs. Overall, our stay was not a very good experience and I would not recommend the Hotel Stanford.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for price and location”
Reviews.Author: tbevis
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter and two of her friends to New York to shop - they are all bound for college this fall. I chose the Stanford because of location and because it was the only hotel I could find that offered a two room suite with two queens (to accommodate the three girls) for a price I could afford. I also reserved a king deluxe for myself. Both rooms were spacious by NY standards - furniture was a bit worn, but the linens were fresh, white and clean - the bathrooms were fine in both rooms, but the girls' bathroom was nicer than mine (black countertops and nicer fixtures - mine was more basic, but ok). When we arrived our rooms were not ready until almost 4:00PM, so were offered a 1:00 PM checkout to compensate. The front desk clerks were very nice and helpful throughout our stay. I liked the small coffee/pastry shop adjacent to the lobby, and it was open very late, even after the theater - this is the same location they used for the complimentary breakfast. A previous review was correct - the complimentary breakfast could have been better. The offerings (coffee, juice, bagels, cereal) were ok, but the problem was space. When I went down at about 9:00, every table was full and a long line at the service area - so I just purchased coffee and didn't try to wedge in. This needs improvement - but it's the only real complaint I had. Another previous review mentioned faulty air conditioning and experiencing a warm room - we had the opposite problem (but it wasn't really a problem) because both or our rooms (one on 3rd floor and one on 9th) were quite cool - even chilly - and changing the thermostat didn't seem to affect it. However I prefer a cool room, can't sleep in a warm one, so I was fine with that. The block the hotel is on is in a super-convenient location. 32nd st is called "Korea town" and is lined with Korean shops and restaurants - a little congested and not the most beautiful block in NYC, but again, was fine. We felt safe walking at night. I used to work in NY and have stayed in many midtown hotels over the years, and know the city well. This is not an elegant hotel, but nice enough, secure, and clean - I would not hesitate to stay again if I needed the extra space at a good price (hard to find suites with two queens and a sofa bed in NY for less than $350). Views are mostly of fire escapes, but that didn't bother me. Was very quiet - no noise at all from adjoining rooms. Maids very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: krissy85 Posted by an Apollo traveler
Reviews.Content: The things that we liked was: good location friendly staff big rooms fridge in the room safe There are some things that we didn`t like so much. The aircondition didn`t work as it should, the rooms were warm. Slightly worn down. The breakfeast was donuts and bagels and thats it. You were not allowed to bring the food to the room. Can`t really see why. The beds were extremely hard, felt like you were sleeping on the floor. Only one elevator that went very slow. All in all a deascent base for your new york stay. Ok value and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Roony39
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with a friend. We were greeted with a smiley face,and after a quick check in up to our room on the 5th floor. The room was a decent size, very clean and comfortable bed, the en-suite was large with a shower over a bath, shampoo and shower gel etc as well. No view but to be honest we didn't go to new york to sit in a hotel room, it served it's purpose good sleep and somewhere to shower. Added bonus was bagels with cream cheese, doughnuts.and pastries for breakfast, as well as juice and tea/coffee.This is a cafe and open to the public as well. There is a restaurant on the ground floor but we didn't try it. We felt really safe walking back even after midnight, Empire state building in the same block,macey's just around the corner and broadway at the end of the street, We had a great time !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best value in Manhattan for the price”
Reviews.Author: SFGoCougs
Reviews.Content: I was aiming to spend under $200/night on my room in New York and was SO impressed with this choice. My room was $189/night and I got so much more than what I paid for. *Side note. This was my third trip to New York and the fifth hotel I've stayed in in the city. For those who have not traveled to NYC before, expectations for New York hotels should be vastly different than most other cities. What would buy you a suite in some markets will get you a dingy, cramped room in New York. I see a lot of overly critical reviews of NY hotels on TripAdvisor. I'm sorry, but unless you are spending $450-$500 a night you should not expect a spacious room with a view. That is unrealistic and in many cases a testament to the level of ignorance of the traveler's part. If you properly set your expectations before traveling, you'll be much more pleased with your stay.* Moving on :) This hotel is a GREAT deal. The location is incredible! We were there 4 days and only had to take the subway once-to get to the financial district. Times Sq and Central Park were both within walking distance. We were less than two blocks from Penn Station and the Empire State Building. The hotel lobby was cute and clean. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. We arrived 3 hrs before check-in and our room was ready so they let us in early which was great. We had a room with two single beds, which looked to have been recently renovated. It was clean and actually more spacious than I was expecting. The bed linens were clean and comfortable, there was a minifridge, the bathroom was clean and toiletries (Bath and Body Works) were included. The room was a perfect mix of older touches (crown moulding, tile work in the bathroom, pedestal sink, very large deep tub) and renovated design touches (tufted headboard, fluffy white linens). There was absolutely no street noise whatsoever. One big perk was complimentary breakfast in the morning (coffee, OJ, bagels, donuts) and they served it until 10 which is helpful for us west-coasters adjusting to the time change. Overall, it was cleand, updated, quiet and friendly. A great find in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for NYC!”
Reviews.Author: julvoet
Reviews.Content: We were 4 friends staying at the Stanford Hotel. We booked a double Queen suite. The room as very spacious, bathroom very clean, comfy beds and the staff at the reception was very friendly and helpful. The big plus is the included breakfast although it is quite simple : bagels, doughnuts, pastry with coffee and juice. No fruits or yoghurt but good enough to leave with a well filled stomach every morning. It also offers Internet Access which is a big plus. Indeed the elevator is a bit slow, especially when you have people stopping at every floor but it didn't bother us that much. ALso, only the location is worth it. Metro at the corner of the street, 2 blocks from Macy's, 15 min walking from Times square, 2 blocks from the Empire State Building. The area is busy, in the action without being in the big Times Square business, so perfect. I would definitely recommend this hotel and book again when I return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Billy_Shears
Reviews.Content: We wrote this posting on city search in '05....thought we'd paste it here too... I cannot find anything bad to say about Hotel Stanford. The location is unbeatable. The hotel is right next to the empire state building, macy's and midtown. Times square is also nearby as well as numerous restaurants, many of them korean if you're into korean. The subway is outside the main door. We also had a blast with Jinho, the manager of the maxim lounge on the second floor. We stayed in a 'king deluxe' room and loved it. It was very spacious (especially for NYC) and was very economical. We had no problem with any noise...the hotel was well kept and inviting. I'd recommend staying on a lower floor if the elevator is a problem...we were on the second floor and used the stairs. In short, the next time we come to new york (unless i win the lottery), we will definately stay at the stanford again, without question.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant extended stay in New York with my sister”
Reviews.Author: Chrissie16
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a superb stay at the Stanford during April 2010. It ended up being extended due to the Volcanic ash disruption. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful especially as we had to change rooms 3 times because of the extended stay. We would recommend the twin rooms as they are more spacious. There is a fridge in the room and you have internet access. The hotel is in a superb location just 20 metres from the Herald street subway. There are several musts: 1. Buy a 7day MTA ticket as you can use it on all buses and subways. 2. If flying in to Newark use the bus to get to the city - it stops at 3 places in New York ending up at Grand Central Station - only $25 return! 3. Go to 'Five Napkins Burger' , Basso 55 and the Hourglass to eat. All excellent with Five napkins being the best value. 4. Walk in Central Park - its free and its beautiful 5. Go on the Statten Island ferry - also free and goes past the Statue of liberty great views. All in all a superb trip.

Reviews.Title: “The best bargain in Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: UStravalers
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel to anyone. We got a very good price by reserving early. The location is amazing--1 block from Macy's, one block form the Empire State Building, subway is steps away. Very well kept, comfortable and quiet and the service couldn't be better. Eat at the Martinique around the corner on Broadway for good food, service and prices. Except the drinks--rediculously priced all over Manhatten. Might be good idea to BYOB.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Excellent staff; lovely coffee.”
Reviews.Author: and
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights recently for average of $200 (including tax) per night (after leaving Radison next door for â‚¬537 (including tax) per night. Extremely pleasant and helpful staff - they couldn't do enough to make us feel welcome and comfortable. Excellent location. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stanford is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Apassionfortravel11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location (very near Macy's) and mid town....great access to the Metro and all parts of New York. The staff were very friendly and helpful! The room was roomy and clean. They even had something special in our room for our anniversary. We would definitely stay here again! Terrific place and great price too! Thanks for a wonderful stay Hotel Stanford!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, excellent staff... and very few negatives.”
Reviews.Author: Sideshow_Mang
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was an excellent hotel. POSITIVES - Location (a block away from Macy's & the Empire State Building). - Quiet (a fairly quiet street anyway, but staying at the back of the hotel meant it was especially so - this does however lead to a compromise in a complete lack of a view). - Staff (the majority were Korean - but spoke excellent English). All were very accomodating, and not in any way obtrusive. - Spacious rooms (plenty of storage space, and a bathroom that's bigger than our own at home). There is also an empty fridge, and a free room safe. All nice touches. - Clean (not a bad word to say on this) - Amenities (breakfast included in room rate, discounted bar, free internet access (slightly limited, as there are only 2 computers for the whole hotel). - Post-check out assistance (held our suitcases in secure room for a number of hours before our flight - for no charge). NEGATIVES - Bed (it may have been only our room - or perhaps our taste, but the bed was overly soft, and not put together well. Everytime you turned over the whole bed was like a ship on water!) - Radiator Noise (the loudest pipework & radiator I think I've heard in a room! Again, perhaps room specific, but it did make for a couple of slightly restless nights for this light sleeper). - Lack of Breakfast variety (it was very limited: pastries, croissants, bagels, doughnuts, doughrings & buns - with water, orange, tea or coffee). A bit of fruit would have been a welcome addition! And there can be a wait for a seat if you don't make it down early enough. All in all we had a good experience with this hotel - and if we do stay in New York again, we would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I will always stay here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WareBon
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpfull and acomidating. I loved the bathroom we had and the beds were very comfortable. You can walk everywhere.........and the reasturants are wonderful. I would recomend this hotel to anyone. Great price too........by the way if you are over fifty you get a senior dicount........CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: afriend0607
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. It has a great location for the price. The rooms werent anything really special but they were fine. The hotel staff seemed fine as well, but we didnt really spend much time at the hotel...we were too busy enjoying the city! The beds were good, the rooms were clean (no bugs or anything), we didnt hear any outside noise, the tv, a/c, and heater worked and the price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely staying here next time...perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shelley_UK
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our holiday in NYC & I had to write a review of this place as it was fantastic. I booked the hotel on expedia as a package holiday with flights etc... We weren't sure about location at first as on a map it looks as though it is far from times square - this isn't the case though as we couldn't have been in a better location, it was ideal. Just around the corner from the hotel is a beautiful square where you can sit outside, its a lovely open space among the tall buildings. There is also a Duane Read store which sells EVERYTHING which we found handy for shampoo etc..as well as food/drink & gifts to take home. Macys is on the square too & the empire state building is one block away. On the first night we went to see New York Knicks vs Chicago Bulls at Madison Square Garden - this being two blocks from the hotel, about 5 minute walk, it was great to walk back after without getting a taxi. It is very easy to walk to Times Square, all in all a fab location. The hotel itself was very clean, the staff helpful & the rooms were a good size - can't complain at all. There was free internet service & a very nice bakery/coffee shop off the lobby. I would also recommend Cafe Martinique just around the corner from the hotel, on the square (just before you get to Duane Read) we had breakfast regularly here & dinner too...very nice & reasonable. If you have booked already you will have a fantastic time, if you are considering this hotel then you can't go wrong! Enjoy :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 27luu
Reviews.Content: The service was very good, the staff was very prepared. They could help me with ordering pizza and finding the right place to go. I've been there twice, at the frist time, I stayed in a upper room, nice bathroom, great experience. But, at the second time I couldn't afford for the frist one, and i think i got a regular room it was ok and cosy, THE PROBLEM was that the window was facing the wall of the other building (lit was realy close) and at night you could not leave your window open because a terible smell of fried food would come all over your room.The location is what i like the most! ItÂ´s 10 steps away from a subway station and you have all drugstores and fast-food restaurants right in the next block.Macy's is two blocks away right with gap, forever 21, victoria's secrets.... A hotel with breakfast in NYC is not a easy thing to find, and i'm sure it's so helpful. Having breakfast at you own hotel makes everything more easy, it's not a wonderful breakfast but it has the basic and it's good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Misshel1
Reviews.Content: Rite in the middle of everything a few blocks from Empire State and Rockafeller couldnt fault it. Clean rooms, breakfast was nice. I would recommend based soley on the location.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a payable, clean, comfortable, well-located, safe and quiet place to stay during your NYC visit? This is it!”
Reviews.Author: Arvidvp
Reviews.Content: We went for five days at the end of january 2010. We booked the room for 330dollars for a two person room for four nights. The staff are very friendly and helpfull, something which we definitly cant say about most of the other new yorkers... Our room 512 was very clean and most of all very very quiet! It was at the backside of the hotel so we didnt have a view but you really shouldnt care because you do not go to NYC to spend a lot of time in the hotel. It was perfectly located for all the major seeings in manhattan. Penn station and the metroline is just around the corner. Really nothing bad we can say about the hotel. The negative reviews here are from people who think you can book a plaza suite at the price of a three star hotel, so do not hestitate people, if you are looking for a comfy place to feel at home after a long day sightseeing in New York, then book this hotel! NYC stole our heart, too bad most people were really unfriendly (except for the NYPD!). Greetings from Belgium.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: LondonCoco
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Stanford was chosen for part of my stay in NYC after much research online. In all honesty, it exceeded my expectations. The only minor downside for me was I would have preferred to be closer to the Broadway theatres during the snow blizzard that hit the city during my visit, purely for convenience, but apart from that, the location for shopping was excellent. Macy's being just around the corner. Reception staff are super efficient, helpful and professional. Personal warmth and cheer you will get from two very charming doormen (I forget their names, but the smiles from the youngest cheered my mornings!) My room was very quiet, considering the location, ample size, very clean, well equipped and the bathroom a generous size. Importantly, the bed was very comfortable. The only thing I missed is tea and coffee making facilities you come to expect in the UK, Australia and Europe. Nice to have breakfast included - served in the cafe next door, and a great start to the day Free internet a huge bonus on the second floor. I can highly recommend this hotel for those seeking a bargain in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale, sparce amenities, overheated.”
Reviews.Author: Ewelch1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff very pleasant. They have a luggage room to give you some wiggle room to do some things out in the city just before and after check in/out. The room was ready hours before check in time. The hotel is on West 32nd, in Koreatown, with a dozen great Korean restaurants doors away. It is 5 or so minutes walk from Penn Station and every transport option you'd need. All that being true, the room was uncomfortably hot all night, with no air flow and no adjustment possible. I heard others complain at the desk. They give minimal towels (one wash cloth for two people?) and there is no little coffee maker in the room. Rooms are small but have a closet and an adequate bathroom. Seemed rather sparce and heating outdated. For 225 a night, I didn't feel I got a good deal at all. Overall not terrible, good location. There are other hotels on the street I'd check out first next time.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL STAFF NEEDS TO LOOK UP THE WORD COMPLIMENTARY”
Reviews.Author: JOHN1484
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived to check in I was told that I wasnâ€™t entitled to the complimentary breakfast that they advertised on their website, because I booked with another website. The breakfast wasnâ€™t much to speak of anyway. The rooms were small but clean and the rooms had a private bathroom. Would I recommend this hotel??? I would if you donâ€™t mind being lied to. I did get the room cheap for NYC, but there were many other hotels that you can find if you spend the time to look. I wouldnâ€™t recommend the hotel because they lied on their website. Complimentary means free as a courtesy or a favor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price.”
Reviews.Author: rvd02d
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a decent, clean, in a good location, safe hotel you can't go wrong with Hotel Stanford. Its in Korea town but 10 feet away from major subway lines, across the street from Macy's and a block from the Empire State Building. Not a luxury hotel by any means, but decent price and size with private bathroom. The continental breakfast is nothing but bagels and doughnuts but its included in price so can't complain too much. So in other words, if you are a couple who is just looking for a place to crash while visiting NYC and don't use the room for nothing but sleep and is looking to save money this is the perfect hotel for you. Do NOT look at website for pictures b/c hotel is not renovated and new.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Toronto1975
Reviews.Content: Amazing location! A couple blocks from Penn Station, 1 block from the subway, and near lots of shopping. Being right in Korea Town was great too. Hotel was nice and clean. Room was a little small and bathroom needed renovating but for the price and location we thought it was a great bargain. Room had a nice view and wasn't noisy at all. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: rosemary10
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights in this hotel and I can honestly say we were not disappointed. Ideal location, comfy beds, quiet and safe, all staff courteous. Always helpful with queries. It was truly our home from home and we will return. Highly recommend. Thank you !

Reviews.Title: “Decrepit rooms, view to a brick wall & terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PhillipArnaut
Reviews.Content: Room furniture was very old and in bad conditions, location is excelent. Personnel at front desk not very friendly - all chinese - and didn't solve problems at breakfast. Rom had mini bar empty and Air conditioner didn't work only heater.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay for us”
Reviews.Author: rocknrollnashvilletn
Reviews.Content: we arrived oct 27th and stayed for 3 nights.front desk was very kind and well as the bellhop,room 308 was roomy and spotless,great location and price was well worth it. 5 min walk to penn station,1 min walk to subway entrance,nyc was rockin and the stanford had a cool vibe about it.thank you new york. hope i can return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: globetrottersSussex
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reviews, I was very disappointed with this hotel. Not only was it the most expensive we had ever stayed in, in New York, but the lift was slow (and at one time broke down), there was no tea/coffee facilities in the room, the airconditioning was unsatisfactory, but the worse thing by far was the lack of natural light in the room. The room was a good size, but the only window was the size of a bathroom window and overlooked a giant black pipe, meaning the room was permanently dark. The good points about the hotel were the location and the cleanliness. However, I would definitely not return

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay in New York City”
Reviews.Author: Devon11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many places in NYC and this is the place I return to. It is very convenient and within walking distance of Penn Station. It is clean, in good condition, and reasonably priced. It is down the street from Macy's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - good price”
Reviews.Author: moxie100
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to NYC & was a little uneasy deciding on a place to stay - turned out to be great! (Recommended by a friend who had stayed here a couple of years ago & liked reviews I read on Trip Advisor.) Subway is 2 minutes away - easy to get anywhere you want! We were on the 3rd floor, so waiting for the elevator wasn't an issue for us as we mostly used the stairs. (I would definitely stay here again, but would request the 3rd floor!) We had a Queen - room was on the small side, but plenty of room for us! (We didn't come to NYC to spend time in the hotel!) Comfortable bed, desk & chair, 2 night stands with bedside lamps, separate ceiling light fixture that was very bright - really nice to have good lighting when we wanted it! Also liked that the window could be opened, as weather was nice (no view, but we weren't expecting one). Modern bathroom - good shower/tub combo, nice deep window ledge to set toiletries, etc. Room also had a refrigerator which was nice for beverages/snacks. Large closet with shelves & plenty of room to store suitcases. Two internet-access computer stations on 2nd floor for free use by guests. Basic continental breakfast included (bagels, pastries, coffee & juice) - nothing fancy, but very handy to get your day started. This isn't a "luxury" hotel, but it was clean, had everything we needed, reasonable price for the location, pleasant staff & we felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is good and nice”
Reviews.Author: PolandAnna
Reviews.Content: Great location - neare subway, Penn Ststion, Empire State Building, Times Squuare, 5 -th Ave. Also out of noise, quiet. Very nice and helpfull staff. Clean room, rather small but its enought when you want only sleepover. Breakfest rathesr french - sweets and coffe, not much room for all gests . Only one elevator for 12 floors! But it;s not so bad! Good hotel for good price.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely return”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidTraveller35
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, renovated spacious rooms, quiet, very clean. Staff were easy to talk to and went out of their way to be helpful. Free internet was a bonus. However, there's only 1 lift in this large large hotel so there was a bit of wait time involved and the lift was usually crowded. There were also queues at breakfast but the queue seemed to move at a steady pace. And last, the towels were replaced daily when this was not necessary. This hotel should use the same environmental strategy used by many other hotels and only replace the towels which have been placed on the floor. The advantages of staying at this hotel however outweigh the small negatives mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slowpainter
Reviews.Content: This is a friendly budget hotel close to Penn station. Great staff, clean rooms (more spacious than some I've paid twice as much for) and really close to transport and Empire State Building. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent! Great Location and Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: SRio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Stanford Hotel in a 2 Two Queen Beds room with my wife, my sister and her hursband. We did the check in fast and with a good hospitality from the desk people. The room was clean with confortable beds. Water pressure was also good for hot and cold water. The position was great, just few steps from subway and near many options to eat (I recomend for value and healthy food if you go to Sppedys , its a Deli just across the street). You have also the Empire States Building , Victoria Secrets , Macys , Gap in the same hotel block. The breakfast was ok : Orange juice , cofee , milk , bagels and cream chease. The Value ? I think it will depend of the season and if you have lucky to take a promotion or special package ; for us we research like one week through many options and didn't find anything better than this with all these stuff (position, breakfast, cleaness , value). I definatelly would be pleasure to stay at Stanford again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality, great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: 2kayak
Reviews.Content: On the edge of Koreatown, with the subway on the corner, one block away from the Empire State Building, and with a continental breakfast, this hotel is hard to beat. Yes the elevator is small and slow, Yes the breakfast is only cold doughnuts, bagels, and rolls (with a toaster available). Yes we had a tiny window with no view. But the staff is exceptional, cleanliness and helpfulness is priority, and the upper floors are completely quiet. There is a small bar, bakery, and attached restaurant (beware that tips seem to be included without notice). If you like Asian food, you are surrounded by options, and if not, the Speedy deli across the intersection is open late. There are 2 computers available in the "business center." Our bathroom had only a shower but was completely modernized with beautiful shiny tile and glass enclosed shower, with Bath & Body Works toiletries. All the staff was really exceptional and we had a wonderful stay :)

Reviews.Title: “great find in nyc”
Reviews.Author: jjp777
Reviews.Content: my family and i stayd in nyc over nite and we were a lil worried about the hotel. a friend told us about this hotel and said it would be perfect cause of its location and the rooms could sleep all 5 of us. the room was perfect on the 6th floor 2 queens and a pull out couch. the price was also great for a midtown hotel. the breakfast was minimal but good enough to get started for the day in the city. clean rooms, friendly helpful staff in the entire hotel will definatley use this hotel for our trip next year 2 days in the city was not nearly enough time. will stay here 3 or 4 days next year.

Reviews.Title: “New York Gem”
Reviews.Author: zeetaIreland
Reviews.Content: The reviews on here are spot on. We stayed here because of the great location, the good reviews but mostly the excellent price. The hotel is in a great location, busy but safe and all New York's attractions close by. We had a nice spacious room, bathroom with bath which was an added bonus. I was worried about being kept awake with the hustle & bustle of NYC but never heard noise, traffic etc. The room was above an alley way, away from the street noise which was perfect really...I'd rather a good nights sleep. Breakfast was great, nice to see the hotel include it in the price. Staff extremely helpful. Would highly recommend Hotel Stanford. ....and I actually enjoyed the old elevator (operated by handle - we had to use it because the main elevator was broken). I wish I had the courage to operate it myself but the main elevator was up & running the next day. Nice to see the building maintain it's old features.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: DanitaZ
Reviews.Content: Nicest people ever! Clean, spacious room, amazing bath. Only complaints-Elevator was slow and our room was a bit warm so they gave us a fan which worked great because it drowned out the noise from the street (horns from taxis, etc.)! Great location-subway 5 min. away, 2 blocks from Penn Station, and 2 blocks from Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Stanford...great location...great experience for NYC....”
Reviews.Author: PatrickB1983
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location 5-7 minutes walking from Times Square...restaurants and shopping centers are very close..We had a suite room....very good and spacious for 4 persons, 2king size bed's,tv, a big couch and a nice bathroom. Staff very helpful.Not so expensive, very good for New York city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chickenos
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel stanford for one week and would definately stay there again. Having stayed in new york before we chose this hotel based on location and thought that would be a compromise on standard but not at all. polite and helpful staff, clean rooms, what more do you need.

Reviews.Title: “Quite basic but great value”
Reviews.Author: annetalops
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with two single beds. Upon arrival, we upgrade for a two doble beds room. It was spacious with a little desk. Window, facing a wall, was not closing so cold got in the room. Good points: new bathroom was spotless. Breakfast is free but not so good. only bagels, coffee and orange juice. With two computers to check your mail in a little room. Elevator was slow and always busy. not very friendly at reception: we ordered a taxi the last day to get us to the airport. It was a chineese car and driver didn't understand us...

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a great price at a great location.”
Reviews.Author: travelmom460
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 2 teenage daughters, stayed 5 nights in this hotel. We had one of the suites with two queen beds, a sofa bed, chair, desk, small refrigerator, flat screen TV, room safe, large closet. The bathroom appeared to have been recently and beautifully renovated, with granite floors and tile shower, separate bathtub. Though the decor of the room was a bit drab, it was very comfortable and clean. The location was great---a stone's throw from a subway entrance that we used to travel all over Manhattan. It is on a block with lots of Korean restaurants and businesses, which gave a cool international feel to the place. We were right around the corner from a deli, a cafe, a drug store, a frozen yogurt place, a couple of blocks from Macy's and Penn Station, a block from the Empire State building. Our room was on the 7th floor; we heard a little street noise but it was not bad at all. We heard no hotel noise at all. Our only mild complaints were about the loud bathroom vent fan and a small slow elevator. The bellman and front desk staff were helpful and friendly. A continental breakfast was included, which was a nice perk---however, it was very light so we stocked our fridge with some breakfast items to supplement it. Best of all, we got a great rate on this hotel through their website, including a reduced rate for the 4th night. I did tons of internet research on hotels, and this was a great find--spacious, good amenities, great location, excellent price. We would stay there again most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly PERFECT location.”
Reviews.Author: Allie83
Reviews.Content: This will be my fifth time in two years staying at the Hotel Stanford, and each time it just gets better and better. The hotel is, in my opinion in the perfect spot city wise (Located on 43 West 32nd Street,) Itâ€™s right by the Empire State Building, but still a good ten blocks away from Times Square, so itâ€™s close enough to get to if you want to check out any shows, but far enough to get away from all the hustle and bustle. The hotel has a little cafÃ© attached to it, where you are entitled to a free breakfast each morning when you show your room key. Itâ€™s not much, just bagels and donuts, but itâ€™s still delicious and one of the few places to still offer that. The rooms include a fridge, a small walk in closet, a flat screen TV and a safe. The hotel is in the process of updating all their rooms, which is great. What I love most about this hotel is that the staff are extremely friendly and now even remember me when I go back, which I think says a lot. I admit Iâ€™m a bit of a princess when it comes to hotels, so the main thing for me was that it was clean â€“ which it was. This hotel is nothing fancy, but itâ€™s a lovely warm, comfortable place to stay and I have felt incredibly safe there and when in the surrounding area â€“ even at night. Also, the rooms are extremely quiet when considering the location. I have stayed in Times Square before and after staying here, Iâ€™d never do that again!! The rooms I have stayed in have only ever had views of the wall next door, but that has become a sort of running joke with my friends and I when we stay there now, so we donâ€™t mind it at all (we actually like that it makes the room nice and dark for us when we go to sleep.) Walking distance to Penn Station, Times Square, Manhattan Mall, Subway next door... The hotel is now on Twitter, which is a great way to keep an eye on any deals they have coming up. You can follow them here http://twitter.com/hotelstanford Would and have recommended this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Second trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: missvega
Reviews.Content: Second trip was fun!!!! Thsi time I was able to do way more things . The hotel offers breakfast which is alwasy a plus becasue at least you save some money on food. This hotel is very close to macys and the esb as well as the trains and buses. I do recomend to buy a metro card to use on buses and trains. I'll rather do this than to spend money on taxis lol. Um i dunno what else to say but that I had my plans all planned out therefore I wa sable to see and go everywhere. I recommend to go by coney island and the statue of liberty and the esb which once u been there theres nothing much to go back to but all the main palces are always fun to go to. Fifth Ave is like two blocks away from the hotel adn you can always to and from fifth ave as well as times square.. well i'm a walker so i dont mind walking for those who are lazy well take a bus or a train and you'll get there. If anyone ahs any questions feel free to coantact me. By the way the hotel is in Korea town its just like three blocks of Korean people so dont get scared thinking that its like a big Korean neighborhood lol. But for sure the rooms were SMALL!!!! But at the end we only used them to sleep and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: JD777
Reviews.Content: Great location in midtown Manhattan. Clean and suprisingly quiet rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Cheap by NYC standards. Rooms pretty small but not claustrophobic in any way. Really exceeded expectations. The included breakfast however very basic - but still better than none.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: lillmaran
Reviews.Content: My doughter and I stayed for 8 nights at hotel Stanford two weeks ago. We find the Hotel very comfortable anc cleen. Our room at 6Â´th floor was at normal size and so even the bathroom. We had not expected to find the hotel so good for the cheap price. the location was perfect for shopping and sightseeing and we felt totaly safe in the neighbourhood. The service was ordinary, the staff helped us when we asked for booking shuttelservice to the airport etc. The only thing that not was so good was teh breakfast. Donuts, bagels and coffee/tea. Nothing more. But that was not a big thing. There was a lot of delis and coffeshops etc round the corner. And expecting most of NY-hotels donÂ´t have breakfast at all, we didnÂ´t care at all. We can recomand the hotel for everyone and would definitivley book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: sudsysarah
Reviews.Content: Our room was really scruffy - clean yes - but the furniture was torn and everything was old. Bed was comfortable though. The first night we were kept awake all night by a drunk in a neighboring room who was having a verbal fight with a prostitute then later with a 'roommate' - doors were slammed all night and the cursing and threats were vile and loud. It was horrible - we were actually scared. The staff did nothing during then night (?) but aparently threw them out the next day. If children or senior citizens had been staying on our floor it would have been a horrendous experience for them but we were able to take it I guess. The staff were always friendly and helpful as we came and went. The location is very good and the neighborhood is good too - safe etc.. But the hotel seems to attract a mixed clientele - some of whom are rather undesirable. I would not stay again - there are are better choices, more reilable choices for the $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!!!”
Reviews.Author: DubBetsy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days last week and were given a newly decorated room on the 3rd floor, the room was a good size, the beds were very comfortable especially after long days of shopping, the bathroom was a good size too and there was a safe in the room also which is always a plus. The room was cleaned everyday also. The only negatives about the room was its location as we could always hear people in the hall, we had no view at all so the room was always dark but we were out everyday and the radiators would always make noise early in the morning waking us up but over all this hotel is perfectly located next to Macys, Victorias Secret, Gap, Forever 21, American Eagle and the Manhattan Mall. There is a subway stop just feet from the door yet Times Square is within 10 blocks of the hotel. It is very safe at night but don't venture down Broadway past 32nd street its not the best area to walk around. We never ate at Cafe Ele any morning just because we like the Delis instead as there is plenty of choice. We had lunch in Cafe Martinique around the corner from the hotel it is not worth a visit, the food is only ok and the staff are terrible. I would stay here again, its excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “ideal base for shopping!!”
Reviews.Author: moomoos
Reviews.Content: Myself,sister and 2 friends stayed at Hotel Stanford for 4 nights in Jan 09 and have to say was very impressed. Rooms are quiet small but perfect for dumping bags of shopping,showering and sleeping(what else do you need!!)This was my 2nd trip to NY and hotel was right in the centre of great shopping, 5th ave to left from hotel and Macys to the right.Room was very warm during the night but it was snowing and -3 degrees when we were there. Would defo stay again ,excellent staff,location and all you need for a girlie shopping trip and price is great for what you get and where it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, tatty decor, noisy neighbours”
Reviews.Author: displacedperson_9
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fantastic - round the corner from the Empire State and close to great shops - two minutes and you're on 5th Avenue. Situated in Koreatown, local restaurants are definitely worth a visit. Our stay was only marred by the tatty decor and furniture in our room (although it was perfectly clean). We had a friend stay over one night and the hotel management were happy to provide a rollaway bed for a nominal charge. Unfortunately our first night was seriously disturbed by an altercation between people on our floor - much yelling, swearing and banging of doors - as well as smoking, although the hotel was a no smoking hotel. The hotel management were very apologetic the following morning and had got rid of the troublesome guests and our subsequent nights were quiet. I'm glad I didn't have my kids with me, but all in all, it was perfectly adequate - remember that you're in New York to see New York, not the inside of your hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “worth it”
Reviews.Author: daisy30
Reviews.Content: Five friends stayed in two rooms. One room had 2 double beds, this was a newly decorated room (flat screen TV, gorgeous bathroom etc) and the girls slept well for 4 nights. The other room had one double bed and had not been newly furnished but looked fine, we did not sleep at all on the first night due to what sounded like noisy pipes. The reception staff were excellent and moved us straight away to another room which was fine. There was a fridge,a hairdryer and toilettries in each room. There was only one lift but this was not a problem, never had to wait too long. The breakfast was tea/coffee/orange juice with bagel and cream cheese (no jams/jelly) and doughnuts. There was a toaster as well. I found this fine to start off the day but after a few mornings it would probably become too boring. There is a subway a couple of doors down and it is a good location for sight seeing (as are most hotels!). Overall good room, staff, service and breakfast for the price!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good hotel, would book again.”
Reviews.Author: hkvontrapp
Reviews.Content: Room was small, but it was quite nicely decorated and the bed was very comfy. nice marble bathroom. the lobby has a lovely 20s art deco feel. our room was kept impeccably clean throughout our whole stay. the staff are nice enough. the location is ideal - on the same block as the empire state building, there is a subway stop about 30 feet from the front door, penn station is two blocks away etc. the only downer i can think of, and i really do not rate this as important, is that the breakfast gets boring quite quickly (bagels with cream cheese and donuts). but thats hardly a big deal. i would definitely recommend this hotel - its clean, safe, cheap, friendly and the location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: joshkatie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in October 2007 for the first time. Noticed great difference in October 2008. Both times we stayed in a suite. Oct 2007 was a junior suite, October 2008 they had no junior suites left and they automatically upgraded us to full suite. The hotel must have had some refurbishment since 2007, it was much nicer room. The hotel is good location for Maceys, Empire State etc. Take advantage of booking your room on last day for late checkout, its worth paying for if you have a late flight home. Just remember you are probably in New York for sightseeing or shopping, rooms are adequate for that purpose. Speedys round the corner is good for food, good value.

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: yesIreland
Reviews.Content: Hotel Stanford is a great hotel for the money you're paying.Its great value.Its very central...near macys,manhattan mall,a great restaurant around the corner and a shop,american eagle and many more stores.The bedroom which we stayed in was super!We had 2 double beds,a sofa couch which turned into a pull-out bed,a tv,a recliner chair,coffee table,big wardrobe,great big bathroom with shampoos,conditioner and shower lotions.Cleanners also come and make the beds everyday and replace the sheets.On the 2nd floor there is free internet access but only with 2 computers. Breakfact is served in a cafe next to the hotal as the breakfast room is under reservations.There's bagels,diff doughnuts,muffins,croissants,tea.coffee and orange juice. we would have no problems in staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tcaIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and so central. It's in hearld square, just right across the road from Macy's. The Empire state building is only a few blocks away, also, bryant park and times square are also so close. It is so clean, the rooms are lovely. The breakfast was ok, buns and donnuts, coffee, tea, orange juice, it could have had more variety! However, I would definitely stay here again. The staff are very nice and professional. Very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Myriamclancy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is unbeatable with Macys, Victoria Secret and Gap literally doors away! This is an ideal hotel for a shopping holiday or to sightsee. The staff are so friendly and helpful, I cannot fault them. There is only one lift but this wasn't really an issue for us as it was pretty much always there. The rooms are adequate and clean, the cleaners are excellent in this hotel and our room was always very clean on return. The negatives! We stayed on the fourth floor and there were very strange noises, all I can describe it as is an owl stuck in a cage! It was bizzare but bearable! The breakfast isn't up to much so we had breakfast elsewhere, usually in the Martinique cafe from the Radisson, food is good but service is very slow and rude. All in all, I would most certainly stay here again, the price is unbeatable for the location. For a brilliant pub, go to Foleys bar on 33rd street, so friendly and great food!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: eevisch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend from november 28 till december 2. Hotelroom was small, but big enough to store all the stuff we bought. The bathroom was good and clean, so were the beds. The carpet was old and with staines. That's a pity, because the room was actually OK but the carpet is the first thing you see. Just one hotellift, which is actually not enough for this hotel. However, we used the elevator when it was not busy so it did'nt matter for us. Same for the breakfast, we were there once at 8.oo and once at 09.00 hour and it was not crowded at all. Breakfast was OK, just donuts, cake, coffee, tea and orangejuice, but hey, it's free! We twice have had breakfast in de Cafe Martinique just round the corner, wich was very good. Go to Speedy's at the corner when you don't like to go out for dinner. They have very good take awayfood. Subway is at the corner and a busstop (the M-bus) stops at 6th Ave. We are two ladies in their fifties, but never we feld a moment unsafe in this area. Next time we will go again to the Stanford Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect facilites; Great buy”
Reviews.Author: billalex
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was small, but perfect with remodeled bathroom, window view, responsive staff, great location in Koreatown right at subway a block from Empire State Bldg. Stayed here Thanksgiving time 2008 at great price of $150/night including good continental breakfast. We hope to come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal position in New York”
Reviews.Author: GlenLeicester
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Stanford. Large room - great bed and room facs, however the view from the window was of a wall - but hey it's New York - and you don't stay in your room! Breakfast in the cafe downstairs was fine and included in the price. Staff helpful and friendly - would recommend especially in expensive New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a budget”
Reviews.Author: crankysloths
Reviews.Content: Though I have been to NYC twice before I did not realise November is actually a peak season - to be honest this was not my hotel of choice but I ran out of affordable options. At roughly $331 a night US - which equates to $500 AUD a night this was NOT a cheap option in relation to what I would normally pay. You could get a 5 star in Australia for less than this - but I am told this is nowhere near expensive for this town and beggars cant be choosers. We had to wait whilst US customers checked in and in each case they were paying much lower rates than us and I suspect this hotel was slugging the foreigners much more in some cases. They also upgraded the couple checking in prior to us who were only staying for a few days. I may be making assumptions but it did stick in my mind. The location is excellent. Right in Midtown, next to a subway stop, near Macy's (though I wouldnt bother Macy's aint what it used to be and Saks is MUCH better) and within walking distance of everything. Try Speedys on the corner for excellent and more healthy takeaway options if you cant face another night out. I found the staff to be pleasant and helpful but the foyer space and the street frontage small and in need of a bit of a spruce up. There is one lift and yes it is slow but adequate. Our room had just been painted - and though I think was done with the best intentions it smelt horrible. We stayed for 9 nights and under the circumstances would have hoped for a better room - but as the hotel was literally at full occupancy there was no point complaining. It was small - and I mean small - not suck it up NYC hotel rooms are small, I mean I think I just got shut in the broom closet small - just enough for the supposed Queen bed (which was only a double) and table and chair and the tv. No amount of mirroring the wall was going to make it seem larger. My husband literally could not get out of his side of the bed as he hit the "mirrored" wall. The bathroom was ok not grotty or scummy but again not the greatest. No rats no bugs all ok in that area. Lumpy floor and dodgy electrical sockets - my father the electrician would have had a total OH&S fit if he had seen the state of the power points. But the door locked properly, it didnt smell after the paint subsided and we felt safe - and TV in the US always blows us away - you must watch "Extreme Loggers" that is just one tiny step away from reality tv insanity. I have to say though I really did love the Backstage Dressing room lights around the bathroom mirror - very glamorous. We had no control over our room temperature and as NY has been humid of late we had to keep opening the window which introduced my main gripe. Noise and Light. We faced Korea Way which means we had flashing neons and yelling, honking and screaming 24/7 - and I mean 24/7 - who the hell eats Korean BBQ at 4am I do not know but hey its NYC! For those not familiar with such things this entire strip is full of great restaurants the deal however is they literally are open 24 hours and all sorts of exuberant people frequent them at all sorts of hours. After 44 hours of flying from the other side of the world this was just too much for my senses and I spent the next 24 hours with a serious migraine. Interesting sidebar here - you cannot buy codeine over the counter in the US - I discovered this the hard way - so bring your own from home if you are a headache/migraine sufferer like me. Another interesting sidebar - if you get really sick and need help there are walkup physicians available in some of the Duane Reades the closest to Stanford is 7th and 50th. So not that close if you are sick but worth knowing as a foreigner. House Keeping went through every day - BUT - they did not actually change the bed sheets everyday - I happened to notice a mark I made was still there 2 days later. I rationalised this in my mind by reminding myself I dont change the sheets at home every day either. The breakfast is bagels, donuts, coffee and juice. My husband was in Homer heaven - but an egg was sounding really good half way into our stay. But as many people say you are not in NYC to sit in your room and if a safe, adequate hotel room is all you are looking for then this is fine but haggle on the price if you can. I do have one gripe - the day of check out our flight was not until 9pm that night. I had yet another migraine and was facing another 36 hours on a plane. My husband went down to explain our situation and ask if we could have a later checkout. Now normally most hotels are totally ok with this and under the circumstances do not charge you - well in other countries anyway...but they wanted another $150US and would only let us stay until 3pm. I was so ill we had no choice but to cough up but the lack of understanding was genuinely disappointing. I can only hope - though this may sound mean spirited - that the economic downturn in the US forces some of these hotels to pull there heads in and charge more reasonable rates to match the level of their accommodation. I sincerely believe this is sheer opportunism gone mad in a city that needs to get stuck in and regulate its hospitality industry a bit more and enforce price structures and star ratings with a bit more zeal. If this hotel were in the UK it would be a 2 star at best and I doubt it would even get a rating in Australia or New Zealand. I can only say if you can shop around on rates do so - it will be worth it in the long run. Some hotels a bit further down - three to four blocks east on 31st were much cleaner and in much quieter areas but still totally accessible to everything - remember everywhere in NYC is just a subway stop away so dont be too taken in by the "Midtown" location unless you are seeing broadway shows every night.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we asked for”
Reviews.Author: Nicola W
Reviews.Content: I will only be reiterating the other reviews on here, but like to get my review on here to help the hotel rating. This hotel is great for the money you pay in Midtown. Its a fantastic location, Room was plenty big enough for 2 ladies...unitl the end of the trip when the shoppin bags started to take over a bit!! Walking distance to everything you could need. Concierge to store your bags if needed and hotel staff more then helpful enough...Especially with finding a chinese not a korean take away at 2am!! The free breakfast is a bit ropey, but hey its free. We only went there once. It consisted of Rolls, bagels, doughnuts and 1 type danish pastry. then to go with these you had, phillidelphia or butter, then Tea coffe and Oj and a toaster. So very basic. Defintiely recomend this for a cheap, clean great location hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modest Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TL6732
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about spending 200 dollars to stay in midtown manhattan. I was expecting the worst, but my friend and I were going for an overnight shopping/bar hopping trip and didn't want to spend a fortune on our hotel. I was pleasantly surprised by what we found. The room was very clean, the bed was comfortable, the water was very hot with great pressure, the towels were big and thick , the staff was nice, and there was a complimentary breakfast. I really had nothing at all to complain about!! The hotel is older and the rooms are smaller, but it was perfect for what we wanted to spend and what we needed it for. Plus, there is a subway stop right on the corner which was so convenient. Don't book this hotel if you are looking for a newly updated spectactular suite to spend an extended amount of time in. Book this hotel if you want a place very centrally located that is simple, convenient, and not overly expensive. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Stanford”
Reviews.Author: LollyB
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and had a lovely welcome from the staff behind the desk. Our room was ready for us and we were on the 5th floor. Had no view from our window only a brick wall but this didn't bother us at all as we had no street noise. The room was very large with a walk-in closet with a safe and a nice size bathroom. We also had a fridge which was appreciated. Complimentary breakfast was provided which consisted mainly of rolls, croissants, doughnuts and cakes. The coffee was good too. The hotel is very well situated for Empire State Building (next block), Macy's (round the corner) and Times Square which was a short walk away. There is a subway right on the corner. Cannot fault the hotel in anayway and they even went out of their way to ensure we could keep our room until 5.00 p.m. (for an extra charge) as we had a late flight home. Excellent stay with very helpful staff, would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends and when I come to NY again will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Danspeanut
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and was a good price at $299 mid-week for NYC. The front desk staff was very friendly and the continental breakfast was a nice plus. Having said that, I would not stay here again. The best thing I can say about the room is "nothing crawled on me" (and it was the kind of place where the first thing you do is check for bugs). The rooms were small and old (and I understand this is an old NYC hotel). The bathroom was a little grimy and the heating element woke me frequently during the night with a loud jackhammer-type noise that the front desk could do nothing about (again, its a OLD building). There is one very small very slow elevator for 12 floors. All in all--I slept with the light on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: miandma
Reviews.Content: This is lovely hotel and well located near 34th st for shopping and also for access to buses and trains. Plenty of places nearby for eating out. Breakfast is nice and enough to set you up for the day....would recommend to a friend..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For The Money You Pay!!! Would Go Back”
Reviews.Author: LeanneGlasgow83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic value for money, you are right in the heart of NYC. You are a short walk away from many attractions such as Madison Square Garden,Broadway (Hairspray was great),the flatiron and the Empire State Building is right round the corner. Penn Station is is right on you doorstep if you feel you have walked the city enough! The only thing that wasn't that great was the breakfast but for the money you pay to stay here i didn't expect much, you pay for the location.The Hotel is clean and tidy and everything you could want. I would recommend this to a friend and i would go back and stay in the hotel Stanford again. Leanne Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: sofke8868
Reviews.Content: Very good location, a few blocks from Penn Station & The Empire State Building. The staff was very friendly. They arranged a shuttle bus to the airport for me. Although the lady at the reception was insisting on taking a cab, which is 3 times more expensive, I asked another receptionist about the shuttle bus the following day, and he booked it immediately. I was staying on the 9th floor, at the back side of the hotel. Very quiet room, but pretty small compared to the other hotels I stayed in during my US trip. Breakfast was in the cafetaria next to the hotel. I always had to wait 15 - 20 minutes to be seated. A $10 'penalty' is charged if you take food outside the hotel (which is quite stupid if you only want to take one croissant with you, for instance when you don't want to stand in the waiting line to be seated).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ncinnamo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Stanford hotel for 2 nights in mid September. Location could not be better, 2 minute walk to Macys and 10 minutes to Times square. I booked a queen room which was larger than I expected with a wall view. The bathroom was a little tired but clean. Coffee,Juice and doughnuts and Bagels were nice in the morning as part of the deal. Would definitely reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: disneyfanca
Reviews.Content: I stayed from Sept 1-Sept 6. I read the reviews and was a bit apprehensive about the air conditioner but I had a great room at the Stanford Inn. I stayed in room 810 and it had 2 double beds and it was comfortable for my daughter and I. For 4 people, it might be a bit tight. Everything worked as it should be and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was clean and the water flow was great. The location of the hotel was close to everything. A few doors down the hotel, there was a grocery store so you could buy water to keep in the fridge that the hotel provided you. it was 2 blocks from Macy, close to all the shops and restaurants, about 10 blocks to Theater area ( it was not as far as it sound and it was a great walk with shops and lots of things to watch) and the subway was a few steps away. I bought a $25 subway ticket for 7 days for both subways and bus so I walked and used the subway, bus to everywhere. My daughter loved the Broadway shows so we stood in line to get the discount tickets everyday. The Wicked show did not have discount tickets but it was worth the full price. We saw Phantom of the Opera, Grease and Wicked and Wicked was our favorite show. The only thing that the hotel was not very helpful was on what to see and what was the best way to see it. But they had a lot of weekly free magazines with activities so you can plan for your time. I would stay at the Stanford inn hotel again next year.

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: maggiemooDublin
Reviews.Content: this is a great budget hotel for a short trip to NY. its in a great location, 10 mins walk to the Empire State, go at night its beautiful 3 mins walk to Macys (ask for the 11% visitors discount card!) a subway station two steps from the door 15/20 mins walk to times sq and theatre district 10 mins from madison Sq Gardens the hotel is not luxury but its clean and the room was big enough for two girls and all their shopping! the decor is old fashioned but at the price I was paying its great. Our window looked onto a brick wall so we didnt open the curtains but we were really only sleeping and showering there. The complimentary breakfast was minimal but welcome and handy for saving the pennies if you are on a budget. Speedys deli across the street is great for salads, bagels, hot food, fruit, eat in or take out. the staff were very nice and helpful and the free internet acess is great on floor 2. Hint try to get a room on a lower flor as there is only one small lift which gets very busy. For a buget hotel I cant fault it and I would go back. they are in the process of renovating the bar lounge area so that will probably ad even more to it as it would have been nice to relax after a days shopping with a nice drink!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pleased With This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vips_va
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Stanford is a beautiful hotel and in a very convenient location. It's a narrow building, but you enter into a very nice lobby with a lovely crystal lighting arrangement in the ceiling that sets the tone for a high-class hotel. There's just one small elevator, but there is also a narrow staircase if you don't want to wait. The staff were extremely friendly and willing to help, and the room was surprisingly large for a New York hotel. One wall was mirrored which may have made it seem larger, but we also had a dresser, a table and chairs, a small refrigerator, and a fair-sized closet with its own safe, which you program with your own code. The bathroom was larger than most of the others we had during our trip, which was unexpected and appreciated. The TV didn't get a lot of channels, but it was enough considering we spent most of our time out anyway. We were lucky to have a street view room with two windows, but many rooms appeared to be right against other buildings. The breakfast selection was limited, but nice if you just want to grab something quick before getting out to enjoy the city. The staff there were friendly and helpful as well. There's a subway station on the corner and the Empire State Building is just a block away. There are convenience stores and restaurants nearby, and a parking garage right across the street which offers preferred rates to guests of the hotel - which was the real selling point for us. (I do NOT recommend driving in Manhattan unless you really know what you're doing - it was definitely an adventure! - lol) Just make sure to get your parking validated when you check out. We walked back to the hotel from Times Square (via the Empire State Building) and it didn't take long. We did the hop-on, hop-off bus tour, which I highly recommend as well. (Note: our tour guide told us you can take the Staten Island ferry and see the Statue of Liberty closer for free - wish we'd known that before we bought advanced tickets!) The price was great for New York options, although expensive compared to other cities. We paid $189 per night plus $36 per night at the garage for our truck (it's $26 for a car). For the convenience and comfort, though, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Stanford Hotel, good hotel for a right price in NYC”
Reviews.Author: panzer
Reviews.Content: Located in midtown of Manhattan. 200metres from Empire State Building. Very clear and comfortable Air conditioned working well Safe box on room included Simple breakfast included with hot coffee (american), bread, milk, tea, orange juice, croissant, butter and cheese. Only jam was missing. Internet free access. Referring the price: very goodconsidering the hotel rates in NYC. I suggest to everybody budget travellers

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: breakerfall
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a lovely stay at the Stanford. Close by to main attractions, very convenient. The room was clean & simple, just perfect, you're only there to sleep! The staff was very friendly, the breakfast was absolutely fine (sometimes it got really crowded, but no big problems there). We are already planning our next trip to New York and we will definitely stay at the Stanford!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good service”
Reviews.Author: HaileySingapore
Reviews.Content: I give it 5 stars for its excellent location. It is near the subway, Penn Station, Broadway, Macy's and F&B outlets. I booked a twin room. It looks exactly as it does on the hotel website. It's a little small but who cares if you are just there to crash? Unfortunately, it had two windows, both of which faced a brick wall 4 or 5 feet away. I am claustrophobic so I asked to change to a 'room with a view'. I had to upgrade to do that. I was given a double room. At least it looked out to the street below and the windows let in more light. For $10 more, excluding tax, it was worth it and the staff was courteous and professional enough to not think I was giving them more work by swapping rooms. Breakfast was nothing great - just bread rolls and orange juice, tea or coffee. There was no cereal, eggs, or bacon. The breakfast everyone else talks about is served at Martinique Cafe which is just round the corner from the hotel. If you want a leisurely full breakfast, go there. It's a great place to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in right place”
Reviews.Author: AliceInHerPartyDress
Reviews.Content: As others have said it is a nice, clean hotel and being nearly nextdoor to the Empire State Building is in just the right place. The small downsides if I am being picky are just one lift, which gets very busy in the mornings. Breakfast, whilst adequate is not fantastic, bagels, rolls and cake - my gripe is no jam! I love grape jelly. It is served in one end of the cafe that is attached to the hotel. This space is just not big enough. They have another room which is being renovated at the moment (June 08) I don't know if this is normally used for breakfast. My final criticism is that the air conditioning is controlled centrally somehow. I would prefer contol to be in the room. Regardless of my criticisms I would recommend the hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: scottishlass8
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location near Macy's, underground station, Madison Square garden. Rooms very clean and beds comfortable. Could do with redecorating though (stains on carpets and walls rather scuffed). Didn't have a great experience of the breakfasts as they have it in a very small cafe and we had to wait for somebody else to get hurried on before we could get a seat at their table. Breakfast was ok (bagels, croissants, bananas, apples, bread rolls) but felt a bit hurried due to the limited number of tables. However all in all this is great value for money in a fantastic location. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mcris256
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 night in this hotel, and I really like it. The staff are very friendly and polite, and the rooms are clean. I have looked for a lot's of hotels before decided to book this one. And I don't regret it. The cost/benefit was great. It's have a great location. Even thought is a simple hotel, I believe that they provide the essencial things for a good stay. Clean rooms, cordial staff, and great location. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mexicobestadvisor
Reviews.Content: The location is superb, near Macy's, a metro station right in the corner. Rooms are clean, big bathroom, wonderful bathtub to relax after a long sightseeing day. Complementary breakfast is wonderful to start the day. Staff is friendly, as well as maids. We will certainly go back!! I've read other reviews and we had no problem with the AC, it worked perfectly. Room was fresh every time we came in.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandbtl
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, comfortable but smallish but had a lovely ensuite. No tea and coffee making facilities in the room even though it said that there was. Great coffee shop next door with nice well priced coffee which made up for it. The coffee shop was also where we had the complementary breakfast (which we thought was not inlcuded in the price) which consisted of bread and cakes and plenty of coffee, tea and OJ. Fridge in room. Staff were very helpful, giving directions on an excellent map. Great location, we could see the Empire State building from our room. Overall very pleased

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rscanlon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Stanford hotel for 3 nights, from April 10th to 13th 2008. This hotel's location is perfect. Close to great stores and a nice deli across the street!. Friendly staff and a really comfy room with lots of space and a fridge. I would highly recommend this hotel to visitors of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nce, affordable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: roseofclare
Reviews.Content: Ideally located, only a couple mins away from macy's. Room very comfy and clean, only problem was very noisy central heating system at night. Hotel staff were friendly. Perfect for those visiting on a shopping trip as it is within walking distance of shops. Adequate breakfast provided aswell, tea, coffee, juice, fruit, buns.. would def go back if vistiting nyc again

Reviews.Title: “clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: blubird
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 7 day stay at the Stanford Hotel. Location was convenient, subway literally on the same corner and great places to eat in the morning. The hotel breakfast was below average, but they did have cornflakes and bananas, croissants (no jam), and some pastries. Our first impression of our 11th floor room was "it's clean", we definitely enjoyed the Bath and Body lotions and shampoos. There was a bit of stuffiness to the room and its true that we couldnt ever get the AC on, however we just left our window open and that was sufficient. I dont think we could have stayed here come summer time. Definitely inquire about the air conditioner, maybe they just dont turn them on this time of year. Overall for the price and location it was great.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for a girlie shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: jilyf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in april. i organised the trip for myself, my sister and 21yr old neice for her birthday treat. we had a great trip. the hotel exceeded my expectations - it's brillaint value for money (we all stayed in one room), the location was ideal - for shopping and to see all the sights (and it was a 'safe' area) and staff were friendly and helpful. I'd recommend it to others - but bear in mind it is only a 2/3 star!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sash159
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location to see the many sights and right in the heart of Manhattan. Just one minute or so to the nearest underground, Madison Square Gardens, the Empire State Building, Broadway theatre land and Times Square are all about 10 minutes walk away. There is a cafe adjoining the hotel entrance on one side and a bar on the other. Didn't venture into the bar but the cafe is perfect for getting that last minute latte on the go! The hotel reception staff are friendly and the maids are too. The breakfast is alot to be desired though - abit of a let down - plastic cutlery and paper plates, paper cups etc!! The breakfast is from 7.30am until 10am, it is best to get in the queue by 7.30am otherwise there will be no seats left. There's the usual breads, cereals and fruit, tea, coffee and orange juice-nothing too grand but just enough to set you up until lunchtime. Our room was fairly small for a double, the bed seemed small for a UK double too. The rooms are so hot and the thermastat didnt seem to work, we had to sleep with the window open but can be quite noisy - all in all though, great hotel, perfect location, amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Depravation”
Reviews.Author: mstoneff
Reviews.Content: Unlike its online description, the hotel is below average in every way. There is no lobby, the rooms are in desperate need of updating, the staff barely speaks English, and they are not willing to accommodate guestâ€™s needs. Most frustrating was the sauna like temperature of the hotel. The rooms have individual climate controls that donâ€™t work, and the hotel's central heater, which is not controllable from the room, was continuously blowing hot air, which hovered at 82 degrees. The room was so hot that we didnâ€™t sleep all night even with window wide open to the winter air. After complaining I was assured that the heat would be turned down. But again and again nothing happened. On the 2nd night I was finally pushed to the point that I wouldnâ€™t leave the front desk until they actually acted on their multiple promises. Stay here only if you want to waste your time fighting with the staff just to get a night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: ellie_jane04
Reviews.Content: Before arriving at Hotel Stanford, our expectations were based on the (relatively low) price we paid through Hotels.com. However, upon arrival these expectations were greatly exceeded and we found a fantastic though low-key hotel in a perfect midtown location with all the services and amenities you would expect from a much more expensive lodging. The staff at the front desk, as well as the catering and cleaning staff and the doorman were all very friendly and went out of their way to support and help us during our visit. At one point we requested to change rooms due to the clanging pipes noise throughout the night. Our room was switched without incident (although unfortunately the same noise in the new room!) - and this didn't at all spoil our stay. The hotel was very clean and rooms were made up every day, with fresh towels and toiletries provided. Loved the shower gel from Bath & Body Works! The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is adjacent to the 34th St subway stop and only 2 blocks from Empire State Bldg, which we could see from the window of our room. Second best was the size of the rooms - much, much bigger than we had expected in New York and the biggest of any city-centre hotel I've stayed in. Breakfast was good - a great selection of cereal, toast, bagels, doughnuts, pastries and fruit, with hot and cold drinks. Transport to and from the airports can also be arranged, as well as entry to some of the city's attractions. In order to address complaints over the elevator, I would simply like to comment that in some European city hotels, you would be lucky to have an elevator at all, and often you would have to walk up several flights of stairs. Although admittedly not the fastest elevator in the world, it far from ruins the experience of the hotel! We could not have had a better stay in New York, and I would definitely return to Hotel Stanford.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: eperlman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location (Herald Square) near subway. Went on a 3 day vaca. with no kids (wife and myself). Room was small but very clean and clean private bathroom. Fridge in room was very handy. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Also affordable parking ($25/day) across street if you are a guest.
