Only downside was slow elevator and our room was smoking when we wanted nonsmoking. Also the continental breakfast was minimal, but we didnt get there until the end. Downsides not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferr3968
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel over the Chritmas Period. The hotel is in an excellent location for shoppers as it is located at the door step of Macy's & Manhattan Mall. The Empire state building is at the rear of this hotel, penn station is a 2 minute walk and it is a 10 minute walk from times square & 5th avenue heart of shopping. We stayed on the 7th floor. The room was small including the bathroom. We had to sleep with the window open all night as we could not control the room tempeture. It was very stuffy! As there is only one lift in this hotel which only holds 8 persons it is very slow at peak times. When we were departing this hotel with our suitcases, we had to wait 20 minutes on the lift!!! A real pain. The staff were pleasant. There is an excellent resturant around the corner of this hotel which is facing Manhattan Mall (can't think of the name of it). We had breakfast here every morning and it was great. Great menu and fast service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: From_the_YYZ
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Hotel Stanford. All the employees we had contact with were very pleasant and eager to assist us. We stayed in a standard room on the 7th floor at the back of the building. Our room was very clean, quiet and had ample space for 2 women visiting for a shopping trip. The continental breakfast had something basic for every taste. And, the location is ideal as the hotel is within walking distance of Macy's and the other shops at Herald Square and the entrance is only steps from the subway line.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: jetsetterj
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at the Hotel Stanford in Dec for 3 nights. My first choice would have been the Hilton Garden Inn but due to Dec being really busy it was not available so we decided to go with the Stanford Hotel. When we got the Hotel we were disappointed. The Reception area didn't look very nice at all and was cold and quite empty looking. The staff were friendly but spoke little English and it was hard for us to just check in! The room was ok - clean and comfortable. Nothing special but then we wasn't expecting anything fantastic it was all we needed and was quite comfortable. The room and the bathroom were of a good size and had a TV and Dining table in there. The only problem was the noise but then this is New York City and that was to be expected!! The location was fantastic - just around the corner from the Emipire State Building and Macys so it was really good. I was SHOCKED by the included breakfast!! They had NO MILK!!! So you couldn't have a cup of Tea or Coffee or even some cereal!! Seemed pretty strange! When another guest asked for milk the staff didn't understand her and just shook their heads! So we thought well we cant have cereal we will just have toast....but...there was NO BUTTER!! or anything to put on the toast! The only thing we could have were cream filled chocolate doughnuts! We made a sharp exit and went to a cafe around the corner from the hotel which did lovely typical American breakfast! We then ate breakfast here for the rest of our stay! On the last two days there were some lovely staff on the reception desk who were really helpful with our queries. If you are looking for a great location and comfortable, clean rooms then this would be brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: TO_travelgrrl
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the Hotel Stanford. Can't beat it for the price. Great location - near Macy's, Madison Square Garden, and two steps from a subway stop. Ask at the front desk and they will let you know about special Hotel Stanford rates at the internet cafes across the street. The room is small but clean and the staff is friendly. The continental breakfast has toast, danishes, bagels, cereal, bananas and apples. All in all, I'd go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Stanford stay”
Reviews.Author: myrtlec
Reviews.Content: The Hotel stanfor was a nice experience. It wasn't an extrodinary hotel but nice to say the least. For the price the service wasn't that great but it did have its perks and falts. The check in was bumpy the front desk clerk barly could speak english and then a hidden expence of 100 dollar was added for something. He wasn't a plesant man at all. Then we got to our room it was nice but the bathroom was held together by duck tape. Weird. However there was a great bellman/ housekeeper that should be running the place his name was Victor and he made our stay a much pleasanter experience. The location was great! The continental breakfast was nice however not well kept. It was out of juice the milk was warm and the room it was in was way to small. All though there was some bumps it was a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Wicklowlass
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 308, a double double room for 3 nights. There were four girls on a shopping trip and it was ideal. This was my fourth time in NY so I've experienced other hotels, and paid a higher price! The room was a good size, 2 dbl beds, and a pull out sofa, a fridge and tele. The breakfast starts at 7.30, this consited of cereals, bagels, croissants, juice, tea etc The bathroom was small but did the job, the shower wasnt very powerful but after twiddling with it, it worked fine. The hotel is 2 mins walk from Macys, we got the sub to ground Zero and Century 21 and this was just a short stroll away, If your looking for cheap and cheerful this is your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MinnieLondon
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from staying at this hotel and found it excellent value for money adn in a wonderful location. OK there's only one lift which can get a bit tiresome but you never have to wait that long so chill. Our double double was a good size for New York with very comfortable beds, plenty of storage space, a fridge and good maid service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a clean, comfortable, convenient budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, old but in good condition”
Reviews.Author: lrotero
Reviews.Content: It has been really a problem to find good value hotels in New York City. Stanford is old, but the average condition of all items is ok. The rooms (and the bathrooms) are big; no problem if you want to stay with your family of 4 (Iâ€™ve stayed with my wife, son and niece). It is located in the street of the Korean community (you will find many people on the street all the time and it is ok if you want to walk around late at night). It is very close to the Empire State Building and 2 corners from Macyâ€™s, the Madison Square Garden and 2 subway stations. But if you like to have breakfast in the hotel, forget aboutâ€¦ In the Stanford the breakfast is served in a small bar inside the hotel and it is almost impossible to get a place to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed for our holiday”
Reviews.Author: lexlondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Hotel Stanford during October 2007. We were three 20 something girls who came to New York for a shopping trip. The hotel was exactly what we needed. It was very central, perfect location. It was 5 min walk to Macy's and 10 mins to time square. There was a subway stop right outside the hotel. For us, we basically wanted somewhere clean, safe and central and this certainly delivered. It has been recently refurbished (although not necessarily to my tastes!!!) but was spotless. The room was big enough for the 3 of us to share (2 double beds) and was very cheap. I think we paid Â£240 each for the 5 nights. Originally we booked for 6 nights but BA was overbooked so we got compensated Â£420 each to stay in london in a hotel and returned the following day to the airport with our shopping money! The hotel staff were very nice and refunded our first nights stay with proof from BA. The bathroom was very clean and new and the shower was massive with a large "raindrop" head. We stayed on the 5th floor and could not hear a thing. The air con hums at night but this was fine for us. There is a new flat screen tv in the room. Also, there was a small window which looked out to another building so you never saw any natural light but we didn't mind as we just had the room for sleeping. All in all, I would definately stay there again, especially if you want to save more money for shopping!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Fatua
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a week of shopping and sightseeing in March and found it to be very reasonably priced in a perfect location. Subway stop right at the door, Macys just around the corner and in the unique location of Korea Town. room was a decent size, lots of wardrobe space for shopping! Bathroom was also a good size. TV had a good variety of channels and room was cleaned on a daily basis. Stayed on the 13th floor so no noise! Would definetly recommend this hotel as a base for a week of fun in New york City!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Neige07
Reviews.Content: My daughter (age 11) and I stayed here in August 2007 for three nights and we loved it. The location is perfect: two blocks from the Empire State Building and one from Macys, and bus and subway stops nearbly to anywhere you want to go. We really felt we were right in the middle of New York. The rooms are not huge, but perfectly fine considering the very reasonable price, and with everything you need: telephone, television, good drawer and desk space, well- equiped bathroom, and clean. The view from the window showed enough New York skyline to keep us happy. Staff were unfailingly kind, polite and helpful. Breakfast takes place in the karaoke bar (no music, just breakast news!). Smiling staff hand out cardboard plates, and there is an adequate selection of tea and coffee, cereals and bagels, and , to my daughter's delight, chocolate doughnuts! Our fellow travellers were mostly a mixture of Koreans (it is situated in Little Korea) and Europeans, including several Italians, and family groups. I would definitely come back again and bring the rest of the family.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for shopping and sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: Zibby
Reviews.Content: I have to say that we enjoyed our stay at Hotel Stanford. It is ideally located. Exit the hotel to your left is 5th Avenue and to your right is Broadway, with Macy's, Gap, H&M, Forever 21, Payless, Manhattan Mall and many more just around the corner, we couldn't believe our luck. Penn Station is only 15 minutes walk away and metro only around the corner. The reception staff were extremely helpful. The breakfast was good nothing exciting, no pancakes......... but the restaurant in Radisson next door do fab pancakes!!!! The only down side to the hotel is there is only one lift to at least 12 floors but just be patient. The bedrooms are basic like every hotel in NYC, the beds were really comfortable, shower fab nice and strong and the rooms were cleaned every day. Overall we enjoyed our stay and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: rhiannonet
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly suprised by the the Stanford. We stayed for four nights in mid Sept 2007. It was good value for money as the room was clean and large, the bed was comfortable and the location was excellent (very near Macy's, and a 15 minute walk to Times Square). The detractions were noise (got ear plugs) and possibly some exposure to cigarette smoke (but I am very sensitive). For more info on these see below. Overall though we were happy with what we got and would stay there again or recommend it to friends who do not want to pay top dollar. Noise: I would suggest trying to get as high a floor as possible and/or a room not facing the street due to noise. We were on the third floor facing the street and after the first night we bought ear plugs as this is definitely the city that never sleeps! We were fine in terms of noise after that, and the curtains were heavy so we could sleep in if we wanted. The only other issue was that although we were told it was a non-smoking room, I am very sensitive and woke up the first couple of mornings with my sinuses bothering me and slightly puffy eyes. There was a cigaratte burn in the comforter and I detected a slight musty smell I associate with cigarettes in the corridor and possibly also in the room, so I think there may have been some residual cigarette smoke. However, I could also have been reacting to other things such as cleaning products or pollution - this has happened (and been worse) in hotels in other major cities. Check in and out was very friendly and efficient. Room was very good, everything extremely clean, good daily cleaning; furniture in pretty good condition; suprisingly good room size (king size deluxe), much bigger than we are used to for the money; very comfortable bed and pillows; excellent bathroom, lots of towels and good toiletries, although the fan was incredibly noisy. We took our laptop and paid to have broadband access in our room, very convenient. My husband tried the breakfast one day - it was in the bar area and there was not enough seating for everyone who wanted to eat. I think the food was your basic pastries, cereal and fruit, not a 'cooked' breakfast. The cafe on the ground floor was closed for renovation. We did not try the Korean food but our friends told us the hotel's restaurant is one of the best. We tried a Vietnamese place down the street that was very good. Very good location, within walking distance of lots of important tourist sites and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Acceptable--Not the Ritz, but very affordable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: bai_andalu
Reviews.Content: OK--After reading the reviews on the rest of this site I was very afraid to stay here, but I didn't really have any options. I had training scheduled in NYC and this is where the place booked me. If I wanted my company to pay, here's where I'd stay. Well let me preface this by saying, I am a neat freak. I can't eat out of communal bowls of food or shower in a bathroom that is not clean. Well, perhaps the people before this review had a bad room--I know they are renovating . . . But my room was perfectly fine. For the price, you can't expect any better. The room was clean and well maintained. The bathroom was spotless save some mildew in the corners of the shower--no big deal--mildew happens--we're not eating out of the shower people . . . Sheets were clean and smelled fine--whole room passed the sniff test. Check in went smoothly--maybe 10 minutes tops. Water pressure was fine. I think the people before were just too stupid to know how to use the shower. It has three handles--very strange--but if you figure out how each one works it's not a problem. The issue is that the shower head and the spout can be on at the same time. Because of this it may seem like there is no watter pressure--however, if you just turn off the spout the shower head is fine. Perhaps the hotel was bad in the past, but I found that the people were friendly, the accomodations were clean and acceptable, and was close to everything--incluiding several subways... Final note--would I stay here by choice? Probably not--I'd probably shell out a little more and stay somewhere a little nicer, but that's just the elitist talking . . . For a short weekend where you want to be close to almost everything relevant and just a quick subway ride away from the rest--stay here. It's clean and cheep--and when you are on a buget, that is the most important thing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Analot
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my sister and mother - and we really enjoyed our stay - it was a shopping trip for us so the location was fantastic round the corner from Macys need I say more! The staff were very friendly especially the porter on the front door - he was really helpful! The room was clean but could do with a little refurbishment. The bathroom was clean. The breakfast was grand. The bar was not so nice again could do with some refurbishment. The price of this hotel was very reasonable. Overall we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: pbguy
Reviews.Content: I needed a place in the area, and this hotel fit the bill. My room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was spotless. The maid service was extremely friendly and competent. I had expected the one elevator to be a drawback, but for some reason, I rarely had to wait. One downside is their lack of a 24-hour business center -- they send you to a place across the street that's only open during business hours during the week and a few hours on the weekend. Also, seeing a couch being stored on its side at the end of my hall didn't leave a good impression. I'd say this hotel is a little below average compared to others out there, but way above average for the value.

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: Caroline H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter. We were on the 7th floor, in a queen sized room. The room was cozy with a real nice marble bathroom. The lift was quiet slow and most times we walked down but always waited on the lift when going up to our room, it was no major problem to walk or wait for it. I would stay here again as the location was so perfect and restaurants by the hotel were lovely with such a variety! Sub-way was right by the hotel also which made everything so easy to get to. I would recommend this hotel no problem, if you want however the ritz style hotel then go there :)

Reviews.Title: “one of the worst so far”
Reviews.Author: yellat25
Reviews.Content: So we checked in and called down to front desk as soon as we opened the door. There was a huge metal vent of some sort out side the window, so therefore no way to tell if it was dark or light outside. On the first night we had to call for toilet paper., that was at 3 am. The shower was moldy, the comforter was very worn. The bed was held up by a piece of plank, they should have used that for the hole under the carpet. We tried to change rooms but it was all booked. The front desk then had the nerve to tell us we should have gotten a suite "much nicer than your room" . We didn't dare try the complimentary breakfast, if they couldn't clean the bathroom tiles who knows what else they didn't clean. Not to mention that is was so hot and stuffy in there that my friend woke up in the middle of the night to clean the regular window AC vent just to circulate cool air. Its weird how the website pics were soo nice, and our room looked like a hole in the wall. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice; loved the Stanford!”
Reviews.Author: rockin_rollin
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised when we came to the Hotel Stanford! Our room was on the 11th floor facing outside, and didnt find it noisy at all at night. Our room was a king deluxe with a sofabed, and it was very nice and clean, definitely above average for the price for a hotel in New York City!!! Wi-Fi Internet service was extra $ (one downside), but once paid ($25 for 72 hours), the internet was nice and fast! Another downside was the one elevator, which took a long time to get. Also, the sofabed was not comfortable AT ALL, but otherwise the room was great! The bathroom was extremely clean, shower, sink and toilet were very nice. The breakfast downstairs on the 2nd floor was alright: bagels, croissants, danishes, coffee, toast, nothing special. But get there quickly, because bread and bagels run out! Also, the doors are locked at 10, so if youre planning on sleeping in, dont count on breakfast! Otherwise, for the price, the hotel was excellent! It is very difficult to find another hotel like this in NY for this incredible price! Also, for Korean restaurants (which are hard to find in the area because there are SO MANY), I'd go for the wood-chip barbecue across the street. Check out Pinkberry a couple doors down for some delicious frozen yogurt with toppings; line-ups are 24/7!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay... if you're homeless!!”
Reviews.Author: hkonsuit
Reviews.Content: Where do I start?! Hotel's website looked great... price wasn't too bad... booked online.. Check in is at 3:00pm.. upon arrival.. they told us our room wasn't going to be available til atleast 3:45.. not so conveinant when you have your hands full of bags and places to be!! After arguing for a good 10minutes... they said they could give us another room.. (by this time ... our bags were already in the room we were supposed to have!) so we switched rooms.. after the hassle.. the manager said he would extend our check out until 3pm the next day.. which was a plus- or so we thought!! We had reserved a non smoking room.. and the room they moved us to definatly had the lingering stench of old stale cigarettes! It was discusting!! The room was an oven.. with no way to contol the temp... we had the a/c cranked and all that was coming out was hot air!!! The shower had no water pressure .. and it was close to impossible to try and control the water temp.. i took a lovely scolding hot shower!! We got back to our room the next day around 2:15pm.. and to our suprise.. we were locked out!!! apparantly.. when they decided to give us late check out because of all the OTHER PROBLEMS... they never thought to reset our card to let us into our room til 3:00!!! Over all.. the whole hotel situation was a complete nighmare!! It was not clean.. you could not understand the staff... and it was just a big incoveinance... I would not reccoment this hotel to anyone... unless of course... you're homeless!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: katherin
Reviews.Content: We checked in Monday 4/9 and were shown to a lovely, large-ish 5th floor room at the front of the hotel, facing 32nd St. The big "S" in the hotel stanford sign was just outside our window, but the curtains were more than adequate to block the light at night. Our room was a king deluxe (with sofabed). The room was tidy and clean, and very comfy. Bath was large and exeptionally clean, which I appreciate! Heating was not an issue, it got cold outside and our room was warm but not too much so. Windows opened, which we loved. Hotel staff were awesome - we asked for extra pillows & blankets & received same quickly & with a smile. We were prepared for long elevator waits, only 1 lift for the whole place, but this was not a big problem. Toughest was getting a ride down, and we took the stairs down often as not rather than wait. Never had a wait going up, and had no problem getting the elevator DOWN on check-out day with all our bags. Cafe Muse downstairs for coffee & pastry was very nice. Prices higher to dine in, FYI. Never did try the breakfast offered in the 2nd floor lounge, Maxim. Didn't find any karaoke in there, to our dismay! Guess it's quiet mid-week. Front desk staff were wonderful. I knew Korean was the first language in this area, and was prepared for that. The hotel's Korean restaurant, Gahm Mi Oak, was very nice. NEt Zone across the street offered internet access with hotel coupon $2 for 40 minutes. Can't beat it. Did not encounter any issues mentioned in previous reviews about blocked fire exits & fumes, tho I confess I was concerned after reading the February 07 reviews! No such problems AT ALL. Checked out Thursday AM with NO COMPLAINTS. Great neighborhood, excellent hotel staff from front desk to housekeeping to bellman. Held our bags after our checkout on Thurs & helped us get a taxi & load out later that day. We had a great experience & would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Strong petrol fumes, blocked fire exits!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_LBF
Reviews.Content: We booked the Stanford having read average to ok reviews on a few websites, and given the excellent location and price. We checked in during the evening to be given a tiny and shabbily decorated double double room. After a request at reception we were moved to the 11th floor with no questions, although the room was stifling (with no offer to adjust the room rate as we were downgraded to a queen room, which had not been available on their booking site). We noticed the extremely strong fumes in the lobby and lift shaft, but put it down to something outside in the street that day. The bathtub in the new room didn't drain for several hours, the fumes were consistent and actually stronger throughout the night (they came into the room), and the heating could not be turned down. To cap it all off I noticed that the fire exit to the end of the corridor had been blocked by three mattresses - and in the morning my husband found out that the only other fire exit had also been blocked by furniture. The excuse given by reception for the fumes was that the boiler/boiler room had been cleaned out the day before. The Reception manager actually had a conversation with a porter saying "can you smell anything? No? Me either". The exits had been blocked due to building work on the 12th floor. We checked out two nights early and moved to the Radisson next door, which was slightly more expensive and infinitely better.

Reviews.Title: “I will not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JMVT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stanford from Febuary 20-22. I've stayed before for business, because the location is great and the prices are unbeatable. However, this time the hotel was unberable. The room was extremely hot and dingy. The bathroom floor had hairs on it and the tub had a ring of soap scum around it. On my second night I encountered a huge roach that crawled right across my bed. I called the front desk and they offered to kill the roach. After a few minutes of arguing they gave me another room that was so noisy and unkept I didn't sleep the entire night. I will never stay here again and I would advise spending a little more for a guarenteed clean and bug free room.

Reviews.Title: “Location but low quality.”
Reviews.Author: browa32
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent for this hotel, right next door to the empire state, macys, and broadway. Cheap taxi ride to anywhere on the island. Downside is the quality of the hotel. We had a junior suite, the room was very hot, even with the heating down to a minimum. The radiator banged and clonked during the night, the room was full of static electricity, which may not sound a issue, but it was!! The beds were old and made out of metal, bathroom was ok, shower and taps etc very old. One lift, this was not really a huge issue, you just had to wait a few minutes. Hotel lobby staff were good, addressed issues, ordered taxis, etc Overall the location is excellent, room is poor. Many thanks

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend it...”
Reviews.Author: jec77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Stanford for one night in early February 2007, it should have been three but I moved out after one night. The main problems for me were banging pipes so loud that I found it impossible to sleep, a room that was very warm with no means of turning the temperature down and a petrol-like smell that was in the lobby and corriders (which I could also smell in my room). Location is good, but that is the only thing really going for it. I complained at 6am when I could bear it no longer, but still I had to pay in full for a sleepless night. I'm not much of a complainer, but my minimum for a hotel room is the ability to sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: jaialal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stanford in Nov 06. I couldn't fault the hotel or location. When you are budgeting for a trip to New York, look no further. You can reserve the suite for as little as $249 a night and it takes 5 people very comfortably (2 double beds and a pull out couch). The bathroom is not very modern, but the room was very clean and spacious. The location is amazing, right across from Macy's and a 5 min walk to Times Square. Right in teh centre of everything. The staff are not very approachable, but since we only spoke to them when checking out, we didnt care!! Anytime we needed extra towels or ice or anything at all, they were delivered promptly. The hotel itself looks a little shabby but it is clean. There is only one lift but with everyone out for the day, i never had a problem. I would thouroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: hudsons1
Reviews.Content: Best rates compared to similar hotels in the area. Clean, safe, not many amenities or perks, but who cares? Great,convenient location suitable for leisure travelers who are not going to spend a lot of time in the hotel. The only negatives I can think of were the following: Low water pressure in shower Room was too warm, no way to regulate the temperature. Only one small elevator in the entire hotel Regardless, I will come back and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: CadetTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for downtown NYC. Location: You're less than a block from the Empire State Building, two blocks from Penn Station, and practically across the street from Macey's. Price: I paid less than half of what people were paying in the next hotel over. I booked through the Stanford's own website, which was cheaper than any of the Hotels.com-type sites Service: Excellent. The staff was definitely geared toward international customers, so don't expect any trouble with that. Rooms: Small, but quite livable (what do you expect in NYC?). They're recently renovated and very clean. Caveats: Don't plan on sleeping in, as they have an extra charge for checking out after 10 a.m., which increases the longer you stay. Don't expect much of a view, either; ours was over an alley. The thermostat in our room was broken, so when we arrived it was uncomfortably warm, but opening the window for ten minutes solved that problem. All in all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: laurac1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in September 06. The location is excellent with the Empire State and Macy's literally round the corner, about a 10 minute walk from Times Square and it has a subway station at the end of the street. Friendly & very helpful staff, clean rooms that are serviced every day. Rooms are small and basic but for the location and the price it's a great place to stay. No complaints at all, would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Do it for budget reason only”
Reviews.Author: naxanderova
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights only. A double bed non-smoking room that came to about a little over $310.00 for a couple nights. The front desk agents and the doormen were very nice and friendly. They always smiled at you. Unfortunately, as soon as I entered the hotel, there was this strange and unpleasant smell in the lobby, which I later found out it was also in the elevator and the hallways. In fact, the whole building reeked of it! The odor was similar to a mixture of gas and cigarette smoke. By the way, they gave you a breakfast coupon upon check-in. I did not have breakfast at this hotel, so I donâ€™t know what kind of breakfast food they provided. The elevator was very slow. If your room is only on the fourth floor or lower, just take the stairs. Itâ€™s faster that way. The hallways were small and narrow. There was not enough room to stretch your arms. My room was up on the 8th floor and just might be the smallest one in the hotel. Or maybe all double bed rooms were that small. The bed was OK, a little bit too firm for me. There was a small TV with basic cable and a VCR in the room. A decent size of desk and a refrigerator in the closet. If you need to use iron and ironing board, you will have to request housekeeping to provide them. There was also a small safe in the closet, which I didnâ€™t use. Window was small and the view outside was nothing spectacular and I could see a parking lot in the next building. I actually like the bathroom. It was small but very neat. Your basic toiletries were there â€“ soap, shampoo, shower cap, and there was this small toothbrush and toothpaste sealed in plastic wrap, which I donâ€™t recommend using. Now major complaints with my stay in this hotel: 1. There was this LOUD clanking noise coming from the heater. It sounded like there was actually a construction in my room! The noise was sporadic. You could hear it a few minutes in the mornings, afternoons, and evenings. 2. The room was actually too warm for me. Youâ€™d think since itâ€™s winter you wouldnâ€™t be needing A/C. I had to open the window because it got too hot in the room and I couldnâ€™t turn off the heater. I think the control was actually broken. 3. There was not enough light in the bathroom and the bedroom. Ladies, if you need to put your make-up on in this kind of light, forget about it. 4. Did I mention about the smell in the elevator and the hallways? Plus, it was a non smoking room, but somehow I still could smell it. If youâ€™re on a budget like me, then by all means, stay at this place. If youâ€™re not hard to please, then youâ€™d be fine at this hotel. Besides, the location canâ€™t be beat. Itâ€™s in midtown, 3-4 minutes walking distance to Macyâ€™s, Manhattan Mall, Victoriaâ€™s Secret, etc. Less than 10 minutes away (walking) from Madison Square Garden. And the subway stop (N/R/W/Q) was literally a few steps away from the hotel. But if you have some extra money to spend, please find another hotel. By the way, the Lincoln â€œtaxiâ€� cabs out front charged less than others. Most drivers I saw were Korean (makes sense since the hotel was in Korea town). The trip to JFK only cost $45.00 plus toll fee (about $4.00) and tip. Iâ€™ve taken these Lincoln cabs where they charged $60.00 to $80.00.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: tuggey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stanford from Dec 28th - Jan 2nd. Overall very impressed with the hotel considering the price. Great location and very clean room, good sized bathroom. Breakfast was also more than adequate. Room did get very hot during the night, but nothing to complain about. Would rather be too hot than too cold!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Last minute Find”
Reviews.Author: SilentWarrior
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel November 4th 2006 for 4 nights. Due to the marathon being run the same weekend, rooms were hard to find at a reasonable rate. After reading several reviews on this web site I booked our stay. What a very well run, clean hotel. The staff were friendly, the rooms were very well maintained each day. The adjoing restaurant and coffee shop seved excellent food. The loctaion of the hotel is perfect for exploring the city and is centrally located with a very short walk (1 minute) to the underground, Times Square about 20 minutes walk, the Empire State Building is in the same block and is a couple of minutes walk away. In previous reviews people have mentioned that the elevator is too slow, it is slower than modern elevators but whats the hurry? take it easy and remember that this is an old building and once you enter the street the pace of life speeds up ten fold, so it's nice to have a nice relaxing enviroment. The heating was also mentioned, it is very warm however I did find the control located behind a cover at the side of the radiator which cooled the room down to a more comfortable temperature. I have stayed in numerous hotels and even the more expensive ones have flaws which you wouldn't or shouldn't expect for the price you pay. The Hotel Stanford gave excellent value for money and exceeded our expectations and I would definately return there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “good for last-minute”
Reviews.Author: oglanef
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice enough for last-minute, if you decide right before coming to New York that you will be staying at a hotel. It's nothing special--the tiles in the bathroom are a little dingy, the bedding is suspect/yellow, and the television has bad reception. But the rooms are spacious for New York and there's nothing outstandingly repulsive about this place, which is good for New York. Overall, I'd go some place else if I had an extra $100 to spend on hotel stays or I plan to be staying awhile in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RESTBREAK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at Stanford Hotel. The hotel was very centrally located and you could get to most of the tourist attractions by walking or taking a yellow cab (which was relatively cheap). The staff were very friendly and helpful and answered our questions when we needed help. If you are going soley for shopping the Hotel is 5 minutes away from Macys (where there were a lot of baragains). The hotel offered a complimentary breakfast. This was a good way to kick start the day. However, on the day we arrived the intial room we were allocated too was a smoking room, which was very dirty and needed a thorough clean. However, when we informed them that we requested a non smoking room our room was changed the next day to a room on the non smoking floor. (Rooms are only allocated depending on avaliablity, so even if you request a non smoking room it doesn't mean that you will get one when checking -in). The non smoking room we stayed in was very clean and cleaned each day to a high standard. The room temperature was very hot and this was controlled centrally in the hotel, which meant that you could not turn down the temprature in the room. The room air conditioning unit was of little help when the tempature was high. The greatest pitfall of the hotel was the elevator. The hotel has only one which was highly inconvienent and took time to arrive when called for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mae67
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Hotel Stanford. We had a King Suite with a sofa bed. Our room had been renovated and was very nice. Huge bathroom. We were on the 11th floor. The only complaint I had was it was very hot. We called both nites to have the heat turned off and the air turned on. The continental b'fast was very adequate and the staff very nice and helpful. Told us which subways to take, sold us tickets for the Empire State Building so we wouldn't have to stand in line. Great location. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: DDGM
Reviews.Content: For a reasonable price (but a NY price) you get a nice and clean room in a very centric area. Very recommendable, I will go back when visiting NY again. Only BUTs: although the rooms are spotlessly clean when you arrive, little cleaning takes place during your stay (2nd day, 3rd day). Also upon arrival, strange smell in the rooms, some kind of pipeline smell. Later you never notice it again.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: jwcake
Reviews.Content: Friendly, clean, hospitable hotel in a great location. For the price it offered everything we needed for a girls shopping weekend. Also had twin rooms available, these had seemed a bit scarce in the cheaper hotels when we were booking. View from window was a brick wall but we weren't there to spend time in the room and the room was spacious enough to parade and store the bargains from our shopping trips. Easy to walk to many places of interest and there was a subway very close that allowed us to explore further afield. The lift was not a problem for us and we didn't need to wait very long on any occasion. It was small but comments on this site had led me to expect something much smaller. Reception staff helpful and they sorted out a shuttle bus for our return to the airport which saved us money. Breakfast was a bonus with reasonable variety to kick start our day. We both felt that the hotel was safe and we would not have any hesitation in staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: RocknRoll82
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked the Thirty Thirty Hotel but after our Sunday newspaper investigated it we cancelled and spent ages looking for another hotel on Trip advisor - We eventually settled for The Stanford. After reading some of the reviews I was abit nervous but I was really surprised - Yes its in the middle of Korea Town (basically just the street is on )but only a short walk to the end of the street and your in typical New York. The hotel staff were friendly and the lift wasnt that bad, ok we had to walk down the stairs once but not bad for 5 days we stayed there. The room was spotless and the bathroom was immaculate. Only downfall was our window looked onto an alley and the window was dirty but we were to busy out enjoying New York to care. New York was fantastic and cant wait to go back - The hotel is perfect for exploring with the Empire State Building just around the corner and a subway at the end of the street. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would go back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: 20wot
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, rooms clean and of decent size. The location was pretty amazing - especially for the price. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but doesn't feel like New York.”
Reviews.Author: Ben_melb
Reviews.Content: As I say in my title, it was definitely good in most aspects. Comfortable well furnished rooms, included a small fridge and we were lucky to get a room at the rear top floor with probably one of the best views in the hotel (over the roof of a smaller building to the shopfronts on the next street - but better than straight into a brickwall as in some hotels!). For the price and based on my previous stays in NY hotels, I was very impressed with the type of furniture in the room and the cleanliness and the included breakfast. The lift is PAINFULLY slow. We were on level 12 and I once took the stairs all the way down faster than the lift! (elevator) The location is reasonable. It's central, but we stayed in another hotel that I will rate as a better location (for tourists) and also better all round even though it was cheaper and a lower rating. This is quite a few streets below Times Square but it is literally 5 metres to a subway station that has two lines running through, so that makes it up. The other let down was as I say in my title - "not very New York." As with other reviewers, I won't fault them on their service. very attentive and eager to help - and I had several out of the ordinary questions for them and a package delivered. All handled well. But this is New York! I expect loudness, arrogance and a bit of attitude. When we arrived and walked in, I was instantly disappointed. No bustling atmosphere and the staff had VERY thick accents, sometimes hard to understand. (This hotel is in the middle of Korea town). The hotel was also heavy with international tourists and this is not a problem of itself, but I wish I'd known before. I was expecting to be in a hotel full of loud Americans. For New York atmosphere, the hotel we stayed in later compares ten times more favourably than this. Sometimes at breakfast the waiter would talk cheerfully in an Asian language to Asian guests and then respond nonchalantly in muddled English to us. I found this disconcerting - I expect all guests to be shown the same level of service and attentiveness.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay--Hotel Stanford, NYC”
Reviews.Author: AVacationer
Reviews.Content: In June, my 2 college-aged daughters, myself, my friend, and her college-aged daughter stayed at the Hotel Stanford. We were very pleased with our stay. The location was the BEST! Close to many things. We walked to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building and even Central Park to name a few. A subway station was close by which we also used. We had no problems with check in and check out. The room we had consisted of 2 double beds, a couch that rolled out, and a small refrigerator. There was plenty of room for all 5 of us. The bathroom was also clean. When we called for extra towels and washcloths and they were always promptly delivered. We had the continental breakfast which was ok. It consisted of pastries, toast, bagels, cold cereals, and some fruit. Get there early for the best selection. On our last day our flight did not leave until 7pm and they locked up our luggage after we checked out which allowed us a few more hours to tour the city. We felt very safe staying there and touring NYC. We had a great time and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great in many unexpected ways!”
Reviews.Author: CADSMN
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very pleasant 6 night stay at the Stanford. This mother-daughter trip to NYC was a graduation gift to our daughter. Shopping, sights, and shows were the focus of our trip - and we wanted a hotel that was conveniently located, safe, and clean. Not only did the Stanford meet our expectations, it exceeded them. How so??? Two reasons ... #1) The STAFF were amazing. Everyone from the front desk staff, to the doormen, to housekeeping was responsive to our every request and eager to offer assistance. On one stop by the front desk, my daughter asked about where she might get a hair appointment in the neighborhood. Without hesitation, the desk clerk picked up the phone and arranged an appointment with her stylist for that same day. On a daily basis, the staff provided us with information and assistance that made our trip go smoothly. #2) The LOCATION - on 32nd W between Broadway and Fifth Avenue! Subway station at the corner, Macy's around one corner, the Empire State Bldg around the other --- and, an added bonus for our Korean-American adoptive family ... the Stanford is smack in the middle of Koreatown! Wonderful Korean restaurants and shops all along 32nd St. Within a day of our returning home, we were recommending the Stanford to others in the Korean-American adoptive community. We'll definitely return to the Stanford.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall good hotel for NYC,excellent location very clean rooms and a nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly F
Reviews.Content: My friends & I booked this hotel for our April visit to march in the protest. We got one of the larger rooms, for 3 (two doubles & a sofa pull-out). Check-in was quick & easy. The room was clean, comfortable, & quiet. My only complaint was the very slow elevator. It was also larger than the room we had at the Avalon when we stayed there in February. The hotel is in the middle of Korea Town, between Broadway & 5th Avenue on West 32nd Street. Although it offers a free breakfast, we never ate there since we either got up too late or had to be elsewhere at breakfast time. The Brooklyn Bagel Cafe on the corner of 5th & W. 32nd is a good place to stop & they have 2 internet terminals upstairs where you eat. The Empire State Building is around the corner. There are 2 drugstores & a Starbucks (if you must) within one block of the hotel on 5th Avenue as well. For an interesting cultural experience, get the body scrub & massage combo at Spadium a couple of doors down towards Broadway from the hotel. :) Apparently they don't get too many Americans because one of the guests spoke with me in the sauna & asked how I liked America.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,big rooms”
Reviews.Author: norny
Reviews.Content: stayed for 6 nights in the stanford hotel.our room was a deluxe king size with a huge bed and a real comfy seating area with sofa bed, if needed.great bathroom,black marble tops and sparkling clean.tv,video and fridge plus an in room safe.our room was 805 at the front of the hotel.free continental breakfast was very handy but you need to get down early as the room is small.staff couldnt be faulted,polite,helpful and held bags for 3 hours prior to taxi to jfk.we were well pleased with our stay,room booked direct with their website for $1238 all in.good deal for such large rooms in manhattan.my only minor gripe was that the bar lacked any atmosphere,this is a problem for most of us irish!go ahead and book,its dead on!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Empire State”
Reviews.Author: Lollypop247
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the stanford for 5 nights and thought was generally good. We were on the 3rd floor so the view from the windows was a brick wall. This however was not a problem for us. There was a bar on the 2nd floor and I was surprised that no noise travelled to the room. Complimentary continental breakfast was great, bathrooms were very clean and overall the room was not a bad size. The hotel was very close to both The Empire State Building and Macy's. I would not hesitate in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Slow Elevator”
Reviews.Author: CONCHYA
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the service was excellent. Our room was spacious with a large bathroom. Water pressure was perfect...the place seemed quite clean but older. They provided a fine Continental Style Breakfast which was perfect for us and saved us many breakfasts out. We were surrounded by primo Korean restaurants..and we never went wrong going to them. Our only complaint was the lock on our door. It would never work with our "credit card key". Almost everytime we came back we needed to go to the desk and get a new key. The price was within our range...the last time we went to New York we stayed in Queens and took the bus or the subway into town to save money. This was a splendid place...we could afford it & we could walk everywhere. Greeley Square was beautiful and Times Square and the plays were only a nice walk away. The day we left, a Sunday, 7th Ave. was shut down for a street bazaar and we did wonderfully...got a pair of silk king sized sheets and other things. Excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for a long weekend in New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I have just returned from a perfect long weekend in New York. Too perfect infact which made going back to work even harder! We had a spacious twin room located at the rear of the hotel (with fridge, safe & a lovely bathroom)which was very warm and the only noise that could occasionally be heard was traffic sirens. Ok it wasn't a room with a view but then again - Skyscrapers and tall buildings are all part of New York arn't they? The staff were very helpful and the guys serving breakfast in the breakfast room always had a smile on their face and were very courteous. The Breakfast choice of cereal, fruit and pastries certainly suited our needs. There are lots of moans and groans on tripadvisor about this hotel but when booking the Stanford Hotel, I booked for a warm, comfortable, clean, atmospheric base in a central location for the sights and shops and I certainly got what I paid for. For those looking for real 5* accommodation in New York - Remember you have to pay for it!! The Stanford Hotel was an excellent find for everyday comfort.

Reviews.Title: “The location is OK.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I used Trip Advisor extensively to research our wedding and honeymoon and thought that it would be a good idea to give feedback. We stayed at the Hotel Stanford during the Blizzard of '06. The heating in our room didn't work at any time. We asked and asked and asked and asked for it to be fixed. Five nights without heating in the middle of winter isn't a good epxerience. One day, there was a smell coming out of it, but no heat. We were so cold, we would wake up in the middle of the night shivering. My husband kicked up a bit of a fuss, but to no avail. We both ended up with head colds from staying here - just in time for our wedding! I wouldn't stay here again if it were free.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Conways
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights with my daughter at the Hotel Stanford. Had read the hotel was in Korea Way and was not sure what to expect - I needn't have worried, everything was fine. The hotel is run by Koreans and there were many Korean/Asian guests there, as well as plenty of Americans and Europeans. The reception staff were always helpful and polite. I had tried to ring a friend on a local number from the room but after several efforts still couldn't get through - went to reception to make sure I wasn't charged and the member of staff said because I'd tried more than 3 times it automatically charged me. However, he could see I wasn't lying so he deleted the charges from my bill and even rung the number for me from reception and handed the phone over - I didn't get charged at all! We left our bags in the secure area at reception on our last day and this was no problem either - just gave the concierge a well-deserved tip when we collected them. the hotel is very convenient for all major sights - ESB and Macy's just a few minutes walk; also Manhattan Mall and Penn station. We walked pretty much everywhere - right up to Central Park but also used the subway to get to Greenwich Village and South Ferry to go to Ellis Island. Had no problems and there's a subway station just a few steps from the hotel. There's also a little cafe right next door for your coffees & hot chocolate & cake! The breakfast is basic: cereal, bagels, pastries, juice, tea, coffee and some fruit available. It's served in the small bar area so can get busy if you go at the wrong time! All served on throwaway plates/cups as they don't have a restaurant - but this is not a problem and the atmosphere is very relaxed. There's only one lift but we didn't have to wait too long ever. No view from our twin room, but the room was very spacious for New York, as was the bathroom, and everything clean and tidy. The best thing was there was no traffic noise from the room which meant a good night's sleep after all that sightseeing and shopping! Would definitely recommend for the price range.

Reviews.Title: “Very psitive experience, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Carligirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited NYC for the Westminster dog show in February and stayed at the Stanford Hotel on 32nd street. We had asked for a non smoking queen and when we got there they only had a double which we took for the one night. They told us we could change to a larger room the next day which we did. They gave us a lovely king sized room with a sitting area which was nice and it had a beautiful bathroom. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.We found the rooms to be very clean. We enjoyed our stay very much and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If You Don't Enjoy Sleeping, This is the Place for You!”
Reviews.Author: Sarafina611
Reviews.Content: Although we didn't like the neighborhood much at all, and our room was a little seedy looking -- the dresser drawers didn't fit right, the wallpaper was peeling, there were several screw holes and scuff marks in the walls, we tried to have a good attitude, and settled in to watch some Olympics But unfortunately our room was near the hotel bar, and therefore we were treated to the sound of American Idol wannabees wailing at the karoake bar (to thunderous applause)until 1:00 a.m., at which point the radiator began to clank loudly, as if someone were banging on the pipes with a hammer! This lasted only for 30 seconds or so, but it was LOUD and alarming. We finally drifted off, until 2:45 a.m. when we were abruptly awakened by what sounded like a bus pan full of dishes being dropped on the floor right outside our room. People we assumed were clean-up staff (cleaning the bar once karaoke was over) began talking and laughing loudly in the hall. I couldn't believe that they seemed to have absolutely no concern about waking the guests. Then at 3:00, the pipes starting clanking again. It was actually funny at this point; and we were resigned to getting a terrible night's sleep. At 5:00 the pipes started up again. At 8:00 we got out of bed, packed our bags and checked out, two days early. We moved to a hotel that was 20 times nicer and had a wonderful weekend. I would never, ever, go to the Hotel Stanford again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad word to say about it”
Reviews.Author: ladybird_glasg0w
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the previous reviews on this site, I was a bit worried about the hotel room, but we needn't have bothered. The room itself was a good size, with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building. The staff were extremely friendly, and held our bags when we arrived until our room was ready, and also after we checked out giving us more time to explore before getting our flight. The breakfast was good, and we even got to sample some chinese pastries for the Chinese New Year. There seems to be some catty comments on this site about the fact that the hotel was in koreatown, but we never had any problems with this. Alot of the restaurants in the street were open 24 hours which meant when you came home in the evening, you still had the option of having a few more drinks alongside some fanstastic food. I would have no hesitation on staying at the Stanford hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, so it's not the Hilton. One should figure that out when the room is under $200 in NYC. I must say though that most people don't come to New York to stay in the hotel room. Yes, it is located at the beginning of Koreantown but on the other side of the hotel is Broadway. And never once did I feel unsafe. Except when I opened the large window to check out the view and realized there was no screen and we were on the 12th floor. So be careful with children. I can't say enough about how good the location was though. The staff was simply fabulous...called restaurants for us, held our luggage after check out until we left that evening, and we even had a complimentary breakfast that I didn't know was included. We had a room with two twin beds (perfect for a girls weekend) and it looked exactly like the photos on the website. The walls were a bit thin, we heard some rowdy neighbors during the night but I called the front desk and they immediately sent someone up and we had no more problems. I wouldn't recommend it for honeymooners, but for people wanting to spend their money on SEEING New York but don't want the hotel to compromise on service, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at the Stanford. This hotel is not really that bad for the price....you get what you pay for. Although not the nicest hotel we have stayed at, the price made up for it ($107.00 per night...Expedia). The room was small but no smaller than hotels we have stayed at in Manhattan at twice the price. Room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was good sized with excellent shower pressure and plenty of hot water. The room also had a fridge which was nice to keep water and other beverages cold.Our room was located in the rear of the hotel which made for a nice quiet night even with the window open.Free cont. breakfast was nice too. Subway enterance is less than 100 ft. from the front door!! All in all I wouldn't pay much more than we did but would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “To see New York on a budget”
Reviews.Author: mhoang
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, central to most "touristy" places. The staff is mostly Korean, and it is in a Korean section of town, with a wide variety of restaurants (do not buy anything from the place called "Cafeteria" across the street - really bad food). The subway station is a few steps to the right of the hotel, on the corner of Broadway St. It is also within walking distance to the Empire State Building. Times Square is a short distance away, as well as all the shopping on Fifth Avenue, Herald Square and the big Macy's. There is a free basic breakfast every morning 7-10 am. We stayed on the 12th (top) floor - for $110/night it was a terrific price, considering that it's Manhattan. The con side? I know we only wanted a double bed, but it was the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in! The hallways leading to the room were narrow as well. It was not super clean, but not really dirty either. The maid was helpful at fixing a broken shower knob, and so was the front desk at getting extra towels. There is a little mini-fridge in the room. The radiator/heater made sporadic noises in the middle of the night - we were told that the whole hotel is like that. Since I came to NY to sightsee, not to stay in my hotel room all day, it was a minor dissappointment but I would stay there again if I was on a budget and wanted a basic and decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DSH1221
Reviews.Content: Certainly not the Ritz, but the Stanford Hotel was clean, polite, and all about the location, which is at 6th and 32nd streets. We had a suite, typical New York, small but clean and well stocked. Located in Koreatown, we felt very safe on the streets, and had a blast with the manager of the jazz bar in the hotel. For the budget minded traveller, this hotel is definately a good find!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned on reading some of the reviews, but was very satisfied with this hotel. The staff was helpful--they immediately let me know a cheaper room was available, which I very much appreciated; I was able to check in early; and they stored my bags for me when I checked out. The room was small but clean and pleasant. (The view out the narrow window was disappointing, though. The window was dirty and looked out on a narrow gangway with no real daylight coming in. Also, the only room lighting is overhead, operated from a switch by the door, which is inconvenient and not very pleasant, either. It wouldn't hurt for them to invest in some bedside lamps.) The bathroom was good-sized, very clean, and looked as though it were recently updated, with nice amenities. (Here, a minor annoyance was the fact that the exhaust fan--which got quite loud--was activated automatically by the light and couldn't be turned off.) Breakfast was adequate to get you going. The room had a small refrigerator, which was also most appreciated (how about a coffee maker, too?) The elevator was slow, but I used the stairs most of the time anyway. And I couldn't have been in a better location: everything nearby, and as a woman traveling alone I always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for us”
Reviews.Author: EPSDallas
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NYC from Austin for my birthday. My boyfriend had never been to NYC so I looked for somewhere midtown that worked within our budget. The location was perfect for us, we flew to Newark, took the train to Penn Station, then walked a couple of blocks to the Stanford. This also made going back to Newark easy. Empire State is right around the corner (a must for first time visitors; going there was too easy). Our room was a decent size, 11th floor, and was actually kind of quiet (a first for me while in NYC). It was clean and we had fresh towels both mornings. There was also a fridge where we kept drinks. We did not have the breakfast, but did stop by the pastry/coffee shop that is part of the hotel, very good. Also, if you like Korean food, this hotel is in the right place. I suggest seeking recommendations if you want to try a restaurant on the street (we were going to, just ran out of time). Overall I would recommend this to folks who are in NYC to see the city and plan on hardly spending any time at their hotel. The hotel staff (who were very nice to us) also held our luggage on Sunday since we had to check out before noon, but our plane didn't leave till 7:00pm.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing to get excited about...”
Reviews.Author: Conor_Montague
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Stanford for 8 days at the end of October 05. To be honest, the prices in general in the area were quite high. The hotel room was basic enough. As others have said, the rooms could do with a really good vacuum! I had a small double room on the 7th floor. The bed was fine, and it was cleaned well every day. The fridge and the room safe were a big bonus. My window looked out on the Empire State Building - a nice thing to wake up to! Breakfast is a scramble (and not the eggy type!), so I generally opted to get something the night before in the Deli across the road and grab a coffee and a doughnut in the breakfast room. The hotel is really well situated in Midtown, and if you have your walking shoes on, you're within a few blocks of all the great sights. There is a subway station at the end of the street, and that gives great access everywhere. There was talk on other reviews about wireless internet. It never really worked for me, but the price, at $10 a day was a rip-off, so I took my laptop across the street to a little cafe on the 5th floor, where I could get my emails etc for $2. Staff in the Stanford are really pleasant and helpful. OK for the 'independent' traveller who doesn't mind a lack of luxury, but...

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from four nights at the Stanford and had a great time. We were slightly worried after a few of the reviews but found everything more than satifactory. The location is fantastic and we felt safe and the staff were helpful. The room was large and the safe in the room was a plus. The room was slightly "warn" but more than ok. The edges of the carpet could of done with a good vacuum but couldn't really fault anything else. The free breakfast was fine although the room was a little small. You had a choice of hot and cold drinks, plenty of pastries, doughnuts, cereals, fruit, bagels etc. All in all great value for money. By saving on the cost of the hotel it gave us an extra Â£300 spending money each. Fab!

Reviews.Title: “The Stanford Hotel, A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I just returned from a week's stay at the Stanford Hotel (girls week in NYC). We had some concerns about what our room would be like because of the price - very inexpensive for NYC!. We were delighted with our accomodations. The room size was more than adequate. We had two twin beds and a roll-a-way at no extra charge. The room was clean and the staff was very accomodating when we asked for extra towels etc. The room also had a small refrigerator which was an unexpected bonus. The price of the room included a continental breakfast every morning that was more than adequate to start your day. The location was great, an easy walk to Times Square and very close to several restaurants and an all night deli that carried all kinds of foods and beverages should you need or want hot and cold foods, bottled water, juices, fresh coffee,fruits and vegetables. The hotel is located very near the Manhatten Mall, Penn Station, the Empire State Building, and Macys. We felt very safe in the neighborhood surrounding the hotel and in the hotel. There are double locks on the room doors and the doorman does a very good job of watching who comes into the hotel. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel on a return visit or to recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Staying at The Stanford”
Reviews.Author: djangobibby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and found the accomodations to be absolutely A-One for a budget hotel in Manhattan. Clean room with a clean, cold fridge and a huge, lit closet with a sizable safe inside, plenty of hot water and good water pressure to deliver it by. We had a room at the back with a view of the Empire State building (ask for a room on the B side of the hotel at the back...the A side looks out onto another building). Two minutes walk to a subway, central to everything. Cafe Muse, downstairs off the lobby, featured excellent coffee and amazing pastries, many Korean inspired, all delicious. Wonderful Korean and Vietnamese restaurants right outside the door, as well as a 24hr take out deli across the street. We never once felt afraid in this neighbourhood nor in this hotel. The Stanford beats the more expensive budget hotel, the Ramada East Side, that we stayed in last year, in every way. The staff were helpful, friendly and eager to please. Loved it and will stay here again, absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Skip This One!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a California family who stayed in Hotel Stanford's largest suite for a week in mid-September. The room's size was one of the few nice things we can say about it. It featured 2 double beds, a sofa sleeper couch, recliner chair, dresser, small refrigerator, and was plenty spacious for 4 people. The price was also right, but those benefits weren't enough to offset the negatives. Hotel Stanford is located in Little Korea adjacent to Herald Square. It is conveniently close to stores, a subway station, and many Midtown sights. Unfortunately, you will feel like you are staying in a Third World country, not just a foreign hotel. The neighborhood is seedy, smelly, and jammed with people....most of whom are NOT middle class American tourists! The hotel staff struggled with English and there was not the even the minimum amount of customer service that one would expect from a Motel 6. Next time we will know enough to stay in an American hotel with the level of service to which we are accustomed. The hotel is not handicapped accessible and doesn't try to be and there are no handicapped rooms. We had to routinely ask for the basic amenities such as soap and towels, and felt that the staff was looking at us like we were there to steal the linens. Our suite was shabby and not very clean with mold in the shower, that sort of thing. Some lights and things did not work. There was a nice tile seat in the shower though. The room had no coffeemaker, and the continental breakfast was a joke. In a week there we couldn't even get a hot cup of coffee, and there was no cream. We also found a cockroach in our room. I never saw an ice machine, but at least we were able to keep a pitcher of cold water in the little refrigerator. The worst problem, however, was the ventilation system. The weather was hot and humid the week we were there, and the air conditioning only worked in some of the rooms.....when they bothered to turn it on. When our first room had no a/c at all, they moved us to a different one, but every day they would randomly turn it off. The thermostats in each room didn't work, and the air seemed to be controlled somewhere on each floor. When the a/c was on, we got quite a bit of cigarette smoke from somewhere seeping in our room through the vents, but when it was OFF the smoke was even worse. It poured in through the vents so heavily that we could barely see across the room. All our clothes and luggage were smoke-damaged by the time we returned home. (We were supposed to be on a non-smoking floor, but their a/c didn't work on that floor.) Two of us ended up sick before we left, and I'm sure the poor air quality didn't help. I have stayed in old but lovely little boutique hotels in other American cities and in Europe. This was not one of them! This one was relatively inexpensive for New York, but had no class.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Mediocre, Tiny Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Audthang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stanford because we were seeing Paul McCartney at Madison Square Garden on 09/30 and chose the hotel because of its location to MSG, and because of the reviews on Trip Advisor were pretty good, compared to others in the same price range. Our check-in was smooth, however, the person at the front desk neglected to inform us that the following morning there was a Korean Festival taking place and if you parked on 32nd Street (which we did directly across the street from the hotel), that you would have to have your car out before 8:00am or you would be stuck there until 6:00pm when the festival ended and 32nd Street reopened. It wasn't until 12:30am after the concert, when we headed up to our room did we notice the plain white flyer posted on the wall stating that the street would be closed off. Not being early morning people, and had not yet unwound from the concert, we had no desire to be leaving prior to 8:00am so we ended up driving home at 1:00am that night . So we weren't real happy with the lack of information. We understand the hotel does not control street closures, however, the staff could have been more informative so we could have parked elsewhere and saved us alot of hassle. Needless to say, we paid $200 for a hotel room we basically only used to change clothes. As for the room itself, it is very small and not kept very clean. The bed was uncomfortable, the tv old and the fridge kept things luke warm at best. The towels in the bathroom were clean, however, the bathroom itsself was not and the tub was disgusting. The pictures of the room and bathroom are greatly enhanced on their website. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel with a great location and are only staying 1 night this hotel will do. For anything more than that, pay extra and get a nicer place. Lastly, I was a bit apprehensive about it being in Koreatown, however, there is a ton of activity going on and great restaurants at your doorstep. I never once felt unsafe. And MSG was literally 2 blocks down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stanford - Not awful, not great.”
Reviews.Author: parlyboy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Stanford is very much a small budget place. Itâ€™s fairly conveniently located on 34th Street and Broadway and is right next to a subway station, Manhattan Mall and Macyâ€™s. The delights of Times Square are a 10 block walk if you are suitably energetic or one stop on the subway. There are a couple of nearby bars such as Jack Dempseyâ€™s on W 32nd which was pretty good and had excellent food but if itâ€™s a wild night out you be better heading to the Village or up to Hells Kitchen for a better selection of pubs. The Hotel itself seems to cater for the Korean market as thatâ€™s who the clients seemed to be on the whole as well as a good proportion of the staff. The room was small even by New York standards and could probably do with a bit of basic redecorating. The linens and towels were clean and replaced each day. The in room facilities were basic but the safe was a welcome addition. The bathroom was functional and clean but donâ€™t expect loads of fluffy towels. The air conditioning was not great and even at the lowest setting didnâ€™t really get the room totally cool and comfortable, in fact it was even malfunctioning when we arrived and had to get the Front Desk to arrange for an engineer to get it going. The biggest minus for the room was the bed. A double in name but designed for a far smaller person. Iâ€™m 5ft 9 inches, hardly a giant and even I found the bed very small and narrow, but with another person in the bed it became very cramped and very uncomfortable. The Hotel was relatively quiet although we were at the end of a corridor and on the 9th floor, with a partial view of the Empire State Building. Youâ€™d still be better off trying to sleep using ear plugs as NYC never really gets quiet even at the dead of night. We didnâ€™t take up the offer of the complimentary breakfast so cannot comment. In general I would say that the Hotel was basic and functional. Clean with so-so staff and fairly convenient if you want to explore New York as a tourist. The cost for the room was probably a little over the top for what we got but as with all budget hotels you take your chances. The low rating for this place is based on comparisons to better experiences in the past at other budget Hotels such as the Edison, Milford Plaza and the excellent Belvedere all of which were of a much higher standard than this place for only a few bucks more per night.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overseas visitors....stayed 10 nights.......ongoing problem with a/c....room too hot....a/c was turned off to accommodate other guests.......very little help from management.......had to ask for bedsheets to be changed after 5 nights......breakfast was a joke.......lift too slow......lobby smelt strongly of fish cooking in the restaurant....never would one find such distasteful accommodation in Australia in same price range Once bitten very much twice shy.......put a damper on overall holiday

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: JTravelsWell
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the hotel Sept 16-18. For $200 per night this hotel was a great value. We had a big room with 2 queen beds and a queen sleeper sofa. We had a view of 32nd st. below, which was better than a brick wall. The hotel is in the heart of Koreatown which provides for an interesting cultural experience. There is a great 24 hour Korean bbq directly across the street. We went up to the hotel's lounge to have a few drinks and were pleased with the friendly staff. Check out Cafe Muse right next door to the hotel for some great gelato and pastries. Great place to stay if you'd like to be near subway, Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Macy's or the Empire State Building.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok. but raise your voice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i showed up at this place to have a one night stand. i know, totally. but the room they gave for the price was horrifying. i complained and got a better room, but there were still roaches in the bathroom and the overall vibe is pretty disconcerting.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice location, one block from Penn Station, in Koreatown, with 24 hour Korean restaurant next door. Clean, quiet. I had an inside room with essentially no view, felt slightly claustrophobic with drapes drawn, but acceptable. A/c a little weak: could get insufficiently cool. Overall, for its price range ($150 - 175 approx), good value and much, much better than other nearby ones (Hotel Penn, New Yorker). Would unhesitatingly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good”
Reviews.Author: AndW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stanford for 3 nights at the beginning of July and found it more than adequate for what we needed. It is in a really central location, only a few minutes walk to the Empire State building. The room was comfortable if not a little old fashioned, but reasonably priced. Breakfast was not much to write home about though! As mentioned in other reviews, the lift is very slow so don't be in a hurry to get anywhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CdnActo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three days with my girlfriend. What a find!!!! The location is superb, close to everything. The room was immaculate and renovated. Very cozy and clean... For the price. this hotel could not be better. The furnishings and the atmosphere of this hotel seems like a 240 dollar per night hotel. What a gem! If you are planning a trip to NY and don't want to pay excess of 300 dollars a night, please go to this hotel, and you will be happy, and spend the extra bucks going out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Clean Comfortable Room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at $130 per night. Room was very clean and bed was comfortable. Continental breakfast was very good compared to most hotel continental breakfasts. Staff was fairly friendly compared to other NY City Hotels I have stayed at. Wish they had a second elevator, but the wait wasn't too bad. Great Location!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Stanford
HotelInfo.Address: 43 West 32nd Street, New York City, NY 10001
